We are running a support group on Thursday evenings and most of our patients bring their children to the group. We would love to have one or two people to supervise the children while the parents attend this group. There are no babies in this group. Teenagers are welcome and community service letters will be signed,
07601.title: Babysitting

07522.description: Member Duties : Two (2) Full-time and two (2) Half-time AmeriCorps member positions are available. The Construction Coordinator Aide (FT) will assist with the coordination of PHFH's construction schedule and onsite construction material logistics. The Neighborhood Development Project Assistant (FT) will build upon PHFH's neighborhood programs by fostering relationships, shaping and supporting programs that engage homeowners, volunteers and community members to help achieve neighborhood program objectives. The service opportunity will include the use of NeighborWorks surveys, GIS tools and community data analysis to document and measure program results. The Project Coordinator Aide (HT) and Home Preservation Aide (HT) will facilitate PHFH's Energy Star and Home Warranty Programs under the guidance of the Construction Project Manager which includes the coordination of homeowners, volunteers and community members on home maintenance, energy and green living awareness. Program Benefits : Training , Childcare assistance if eligible , Health Coverage , Education award upon successful completion of service , Living Allowance . ST. PAUL’S COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION AMERICORPS PROGRAM BENEFITS 2017-2018 AmeriCorps is the domestic version of the Peace Corps. AmeriCorps Members dedicate one year of their life to serve communities throughout the United States that are in need. For this year of dedication, individuals earn a living stipend, education award, and more! SPCDC AmeriCorps Members serve in all aspects of the agency's work. Duties range from working in the SPCDC Food Pantry, case management in our homeless men's shelter, and mentoring students in after school and summer programs throughout the City of Paterson, NJ. SPCDC offers its members different benefits based on a member’s level of commitment. *Part Time Members commit to serve 900 hours within a year (approximately 20-25 hours per week). Position Type: Part-Time Volunteer Hours to Complete by 12/31/18: 900 Bi-weekly Financial Stipend (Without Taxes): $257.69 Total Stipend Amount for the Year: $6,700.00 Educational Award: $2,960.00 (after successful completion of service term) *Access to NJSCNCS Trainings, Professional Development Workshops, & Access to AmeriCorps Alumni Resources *Participation in FREE End of the Year Trip to Washington D.C Contact AmeriCorps Program Director, Rachelle Thompson for more information at rthompson@stpaulscdcnj.org or (973) 710-3900 ext. 448 Terms : Permits attendance at school during off hours , Uniforms provided and required , Permits working at another job during off hours . Service Areas : Neighborhood Revitalization , Housing , Community Outreach , Community and Economic Development . Skills : General Skills , Social Services , Trade/Construction , Communications , Architectural Planning , Non-Profit Management , Urban Planning , Business/Entrepreneur , Computers/Technology . Service Description : Paterson Habitat for Humanity (PHFH) is an Energy Star Certified, Community Builder striving to serve as many families as possible with sustainable homeownership as a catalyst for community transformation.
07522.title: Paterson Habitat for Humanity (AmeriCorps)

07065.description: Relay For Life of RAHWAY is seeking dedicated volunteers to join our EVENT LEADERSHIP COMMITTEE and help make our 2018 Relay For Life event a big success! Do you live or work in/near RAHWAY NJ area? Do you have any experience with - recruiting, coaching, fundraising, community engagement, media/publicity, logistics, event planning, sales, networking, sponsorship, grassroots marketing? Have you been personally touched by cancer - through a family, friend or loved one? Would you like an opportunity to meet new people/connect with your community? Are you looking for an opportunity to make a direct impact while learning new skills and/or sharing your knowledge with others? If so, then we welcome you to join our Event Leadership Committee and be part of the world’s largest fundraising event to end cancer. By becoming a Relay For Life Event Leadership Volunteer, you have the opportunity to make a tangible impact in the fight against cancer, gain valuable leadership skills, and receive the honor and satisfaction of helping others in your community enjoy a memorable experience. *To learn more about how you can get involved, please contact - Vicky Allen vicky.allen@cancer.org / 732.292.4264*
07065.title: Relay For Life of RAHWAY - Join our Event Leadership Committee!

11368.description: On Sunday, May 20th, 2018, the Tourette Association of America will be holding it's annual National tiChallenge and Family Fun Walk! Over 300 individuals attend in support of the Association's mission -- making life better for all people affected by Tourette and Tic Disorders. There will be food, performers and children's activities, but to add to the family fun we are looking for a FUN and INTERACTIVE instructor willing to volunteer their time for the day! We'll supply the people, just need your talent and some upbeat family friendly moves to prepare our participants before they Run/Walk! Must know how to DJ and have equipment. We hope you can join us! Marketing opportunities are available in exchange for your time. The Tourette Association will also provide a letter of recognition as proof of time volunteered. Volunteers will be asked to fill out a form to provide basic information and may need to provide references. Contact Theodore Perdik 718-224-2999 ext 226 theo.perdik@touretee.org About Tourette: Tourette is part of a spectrum of hereditary, childhood-onset, neurodevelopmental conditions referred to as Tic Disorders. These conditions affect both children and adults, causing them to make sudden, uncontrollable movements and/or sounds called tics (e.g. head bobbing, arm jerking, shoulder shrugging and grunting). Non-tic features, such as Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD), Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) and learning difficulties, often develop in affected individuals. Symptoms in Tic Disorders can range from mild to severe and, in some cases, can be self-injurious, debilitating and markedly reduce quality of life. While some treatments are available for people with Tourette and other Tic Disorders, approaches to care are inconsistent and medications are often ineffective.
11368.title: Zumba/ Warm-Up Instructor

Over 300 individuals attend in support of the Association's mission -- making life better for all people affected by Tourette and Tic Disorders. There will be food, performers and children's activities, but to add to the family fun we are looking for a CERTIFIED Masseuses or Masseuses in training to volunteer their time for the day! These individuals support the TAA Mission - Making life better for all people affected by Tourette and Tic Disorders. There will be music, food, and performers to add to the family fun. We are looking for stage performers (singers, acoustic artists, jugglers, etc) willing to donate their time and talent. Please kindly push the \"I want to help button\" and provide us with some brief information including: Name, Contact phone number, talent, performance examples (Youtube, Facebook, etc). 10977.description: Here at the Chestnut Ridge Middle School library, we need volunteers to run different programs and clubs. We have 575 students in grade 7 & 8 who would greatly benefit from interacting with adults. We need a chess mentor as well as some artists. In the STEM (science & math) subjects, our students need tutors to revisit basics. We also have many students who do not speak English and need tutoring. We are eager to start various programs but we need volunteers to come and help.
10977.title: Help my students rise up!

07726.description: SATURDAY APRIL 28, 2018 Volunteers Needed for various areas including but not limited to: Directional Activity Guides Photographers/Videographers Breakdown of event (approx. 11am-1230pm only) After-party celebration Set-up of materials if needed etc. Please use this link to sign-up via Google Docs: https://goo.gl/forms/tdSE4o7CcocwZRHJ3
07726.title: Easterseals NJ's Play With Purpose Fundraiser

07726.description: The success of Walk MS is directly related to the wonderful volunteers who dedicate their time to the chapter. We welcome volunteers of all ages, abilities and talents to assist with a variety of volunteer opportunities. There is only one requirement - a desire to see a world free of MS! All Walk MS volunteers receive: Volunteer T-shirt Snacks and beverages Community service hours Plenty of smiles, high fives and thanks! Check out our Walk MS Volunteer Opportunities! Check-In Crew: Volunteers assist in event set-up, register walk-on participants, and hand out T-shirts. 7 AM - 11 AM Cheer Crew: Encourage and cheer-on our event participants. 9 AM - 2 PM Set-up/Break-down Crew: Volunteers will assist with setting up and breaking down tables and chairs, posting signage and moving boxes/other event supplies (must be able to lift boxes, stand for long periods of time and bend). Set-up: 6:30 AM - 11 AM Break-down: 10 AM - 2 PM Entertainers: We’re looking for musicians, DJs, face painters, magicians, clowns, balloon artists and more to donate their time and join the movement. Photographers: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. TO REGISTER visit: www.walkms.org
07726.title: Join the Movement! Volunteer at Walk MS 2018 in Manalapan!
07726.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07931.description: The Arc Foundation of Somerset County is seeking an intern for 3 to 4 hours a week who is interested in learning the day to day tasks within the fundraising and marketing arm of The Arc Foundation of Somerset County. Duties include: Learning/Working with a donor application program for entries and reporting Learning/Working with the creation and design of new/revised agency department brochures and website content Learning/Working and supporting the planning, organizing, and day to day functions that lead up to a Golf Fundraising Event on September 17, 2018 (new event) and Arc Angel Gala on November 2, 2018. This includes ongoing marketing, sponsorship solicitation, community outreach, social media marketing, recruiting, and all on-site day of event operations. Learning/Working on the Camp Jotoni Capital Campaign including assisting with outreach and marketing Website content and social media development for \"The Achievement Center\" at Raritan Valley Community College The hours needed for this internship will vary based on the individual's schedule, however, we are looking for a total of 3-4 hours per week Monday-Friday during business hours.
07931.title: Marketing/Event Planning/Fundraising Intern Wanted

07932.description: This is an excellent opportunity for groups or businesses to volunteer! Since 2002 we have hosted a free STEM (Science Technology Engineering & Math) competition for middle school students in north NJ. This program challenges the students to work as a team to create a model solar powered car. In the process they learn communication skills, alternative energy technology, the engineering design process and have best of all they have fun! We award students for Speed, Engineering, Craftsmanship, Best Use of Recycled Materials and Progress Journal. We need volunteers to assist with the Speed portion of the competition by being Start Line and Finish Line Judges. We need Vehicle Judges to score cars in Engineering, Craftsmanship and Best Use of Recycled Materials. We have remote volunteer opportunities as well for scoring the students digital Progress Journal. We need volunteers to help at our Fix-It Table to repair broken cars. We need volunteers to distribute a digital survey for teachers and students. Most of all, we need volunteers that will be a positive and supportive voice as hundreds of middle school students present their creations. We need our volunteers to be able to arrive at 7:30am. Students arrive at 8:30am and racing begins at 9am. The award ceremony concludes at noon the latest and then we take down the event. This is an outdoor event but if we have inclement weather, we move indoors. You will be provided with an official \"Volunteer\" shirt to wear all day as well as a thank you present for your time. If this sounds like something you'd be interested in, please reach out to me at ktomasicchio@transoptions.org or call our office at 973-267-7600.
07932.title: Volunteer at County Finals for Model Solar Car Competition!

10514.description: AIDSfreeAFRICA collects donations of items needed in Cameroon, Africa. We will be picking up unsold items immediately after FCC's 2018 Barn Sale and delivering them to a storage location in Ossining.
10514.title: Donation pickup in Chappaqua on 4/21

06840.description: Since 2001, the Multiple Myeloma Research Foundation’s family-friendly 5K walk/run program has raised both awareness and funds to support urgent multiple myeloma research. Today, the series is held annually in thirteen cities and participation offers hope, camaraderie and knowledge sharing within our myeloma community and beyond. We’ll be at New Canaan High School on Sunday, June 10th, and need your help in making this year’s event a great day for our patients as well as their friends and family members! Volunteers can assist in a variety of ways, serving as part of the Welcome Team, Course Team, Event Team or Flex Team. Volunteers will also receive a free t-shirt on the day of the race! Groups welcome! To register, please click the link below: https://walkrun.themmrf.org/tristate18/Account/Register Contact volunteers@themmrf.org with questions or for more information.
06840.title: MMRF Team for Cures 5K Walk/Run Tri-State

07030.description: CASA volunteers are ordinary people - men and women, retirees and busy professionals - who have the opportunity to directly influence a foster child's life across many significant and far-reaching concerns such as medical care, academics, and enrichment activities. We are looking for individuals with a desire to help children in need of one-on-one attention. The first step to becoming a volunteer is to attend an information session. Please join us for a half-hour to learn how you can make a difference in a foster child's life. Please join us to learn how you can become a volunteer advocate and help improve the lives of foster children!
07030.title: Hudson County CASA Information Session

07032.description: Change Someone's Life - Become a Literacy Tutor Literacy NJ West Hudson Programs is recruiting volunteer tutors to help adult learners improve their literacy skills. Tutors receive 12 hours of training during three sessions, where they learn how to: help students prepare for the U.S. citizenship test prepare adult learners for the GED lead an ESL conversation group lead a small ESL group The curriculum is provided, and tutors sign up for one semester at a time -- summer, fall or spring. Literacy NJ West Hudson Programs will offer tutor training from 9:00 - 1:00pm. on January 13th, January 20th and February 3rd at Kearny Main Library located at 318 Kearny Ave, Kearny Ave 07032.
07032.title: Volunteer ESL Tutor
07032.org: Literacy New Jersey - West Hudson Programs

07950.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07950.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike!

07950.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike!

07039.description: Do you love to dance? Join our Hot Wheels ballroom dance team! Volunteers are needed to serve as dance partners to high school students with disabilities in our ballroom dance program. Volunteers will be paired with a student who uses a wheelchair. They will then attend weekly dance classes to be instructed in the rumba and chacha. Expect a very exciting and fulfilling experience as you and your partner advance in skill and friendship every week! Experience not required, but volunteers must be energetic and able to follow the beat of the music. Class takes place Wednesdays 12:15-1:30 at Horizon High School in Livingston. Attendance to all classes is necessary. Dates are: 3/14, 3/21, 3/28, 4/11, 4/18, 4/25, 5/2.
07039.title: ballroom dance (no experience needed)

07039.description: We are looking for a very special volunteer to assist with the presentation of art lessons to primary and middle school students with special needs. Volunteer will work with a team of two other volunteers. Materials and lessons provided, you bring the pizazz! Volunteer must be high energy and animated during the presentation of lessons to capture the attention of children and to build excitement for the activity. Volunteer must also have the ability to switch gears when appropriate to show calm and patience while encouraging students in their efforts. Looking for a volunteer who is a natural at building people up! Organizational skills and clear-thinking are essential. Volunteer will need to bring class through a series of steps to create their artwork and disseminate supplies at key points while also tracking their usage. Volunteer will also be in charge of maintaining supplies. Volunteer will be needed for Tuesdays 9:30am-12:00pm on the following dates: 2/27, 3/6, 3/13, 3/20, 3/27, 4/10, 4/17, 4/24 Availability for all Tuesdays is a must. This is a great opportunity for anyone with an art therapy background or a college student going into special ed or OT, SLP or PT (not a requirement.) No need to be a professional artist but you should consider yourself crafty and creative.
07039.title: art lesson assistant for classes with special needs

07039.description: Become a Fall Seasons of Service Project Coordinator with Jersey Cares this June! Come participate in a 10-week leadership program and build your leadership, communication and project management skills. Project Coordinators (PC's), volunteer in a leadership capacity at our volunteer opportunities and provide organization and a team atmosphere for every volunteer experience. Project Coordinators (or PCs) provide leadership in Jersey Cares’ recurring volunteer opportunities by serving as a liaison between volunteers, nonprofit partners, and Jersey Cares. They encourage volunteers to \"Be the Change\" and provide directions during projects. It’s a fun learning opportunity where you get to network with nonprofits and other community leaders while being supported by a cohort of other volunteer leaders. Typically, Project Coordinators commit to 1+ projects per month for 6 months at a time, but the Seasons of Service Program is an accelerated course in a sense. Instead of 6 months, Seasons of Service Project Coordinators take on 10 weeks (though you may certainly continue as a Project Coordinator after that time), and have a chance to work more intimately with their peers; discussions and team-building are encouraged during Seasons of Service. READ MORE: https://www.jerseycares.org/JC_Project_Coordinator SIGN UP HERE: https://www.jerseycares.org/HOC__Volunteer_Opportunity_Details_Page?id=a0CA000000n8CQN Contact: Dawn Browning Programs Manager, Leadership Development Gabriella@jerseycares.org (973) 533-1993, ext. 20
07039.title: Become a Volunteer Leader - Fall Seasons of Service Program

10701.description: Mentor wil develop supportive, consistent mentoring relationship with a child through recreational play and paraprofessional therapeutic techniques. Help children explore and cope with social and/or family struggles. The Reach & Rise program has changes the lives of many young people in Yonkers. We want to continue that trend, but we can not do it without your help. Come and bring a revolutionary change to Yonkers youth and become a mentor today.
10701.title: Volunteer Mentor

10701.description: Neighbors Link is recruiting volunteers to participate in our ESL (English as a Second Language) tutoring program. The program is on Thursdays from 10-11:30 at our site in Yonkers. 320 Walnut Street, Yonkers.
10701.title: ESL  Volunteers

10701.description: Neighbors Link is recruiting volunteers for our Parent Child Together Program occuring at our Yonkers Site. Thank you for your interest in volunteering in our Parent Child Together program. Parent Child Together provides parents with peer to peer learning opportunities with a focus on positive parenting skills, early childhood development and school readiness. While the parents learn, the children participate in activities within the classroom covering shapes, colors, numbers, letters, pre literacy concepts as well as helping them gain the social emotional and self regulation skills needed prior to entering Kindergarten. This is a 2 hour program in which the first hour the parents and children work separately and at this point, staff and volunteers help the children with separation and also carrying out the activities for the hour. In the second hour, parents and children come together for activities and the role of the staff and volunteers at this point, is to model techniques for struggling parents and assist when a parent has more than one child in the program.
10701.title: Parent Child Together program volunteer

10701.description: Neighbors Link is recruiting volunteers for our Parent Child Together Program occuring at our Yonkers Site. Thank you for your interest in volunteering in our Parent Child Together program. Parent Child Together provides parents with peer to peer learning opportunities with a focus on positive parenting skills, early childhood development and school readiness. While the parents learn, the children participate in activities within the classroom covering shapes, colors, numbers, letters, pre literacy concepts as well as helping them gain the social emotional and self regulation skills needed prior to entering Kindergarten. In the second hour, parents and children come together for activities and the role of the staff and volunteers at this point, is to model techniques for struggling parents and assist when a parent has more than one child in the program.
10701.title: Parent Child Together program volunteer

11212.description: Do you believe every child and family deserve the right to buy and eat fresh produce and healthy food at affordable prices? Are you into food justice and do you believe healthy eating is a civil right? Then, work with students, parents, educators and the community to build school-run Hip2B Healthy Market/Farmstand/Fleas in Brownsville, Brooklyn and in Flatbush, Brooklyn. Both these neighborhoods are ranked among NYC's most food-insecure zones, by the NYC Health Dept. and multiple studies. There is limited access to fruits and vegetables and overwhelming junk food options. These neighborhoods have among the highest obesity, diabetes, heart disease rates in the city - mainly due to lack of access to affordable fresh produce and healthy activities. Be the change! Seeking volunteers on these days! Choose any: In school, working with elementary and/or middle school students (btw 8 am and 3 pm, hours optional) - Tuesdays am - Help prep market in Flatbush (hours flexible) - - Wednesday am - Help run market - 7 -10 am (and offer any special cooking, recipes, etc.) - Thursdays - any time all day in Brownsville (help prep for market and cook with kids) - Friday am (Brownsville) - 7-10 am - Help run market and other activities - Saturdays, 9-3 pm (Brownsville) - Help run market and do activities with kids and families, including yoga, fitness like zumba, art, tutor, cook healthy recipes, etc. Do you garden? Do you want to help children grow food as well? Let us know. Looking for anyone who wants to work with students and families and educators and the local commuity to effect sustainable change by building local capacity. All talents and skills welcome - even an hour-long yoga class. Yes, we give internships (and welcome students of all ages to get community service credits, internship credits, etc.) Can you cook healthy? Please offer a recipe, a demo or class, whatever you'd like to share. We can schedule together and we will promote your business. Want to join a new flea? Have a home business and want to get more exposure? Join us. WE LAUNCH BROWNSVILLE ON FEB. 3 AND FLATBUSH ON MARCH 7. Saturday Market: Set-up: 9-10 am Activities: 10 am - 2 pm Breakdown: 2-3 pm School days - we arrange with you. Do you cook or want to share a healthy recipe that day? Even hot oatmeal or smoothies? Then help us run our Hip2B Healthy Markets.. No experience necessary - just a passion for healthy food and sharing nutrition and a quality life with all. Do you want to lead a healthy workshop - even with friends? A cooking demo or a dance class? In health profession? Can you do blood pressure screenings, offer nutrition or diabetes education or more? Anything more? Please join us. Parents are asking! You can also offer any kind of physical activity - dance, zumba, soccer, yoga - just for an hour in the gym. Seeds in the Middle is a joyful partnership with volunteers and communities to have fun while getting healthy and empowering kids to create their own healthy environments, when there's nothing around them. Central Brooklyn is one of 3 neighborhoods with the highest obesity, diabetes and heart disease rates - due to lack of accessible, affordable fresh food and fitness. Let's change that together. Everyone is welcome. All ages welcome, families, too! Students - get community service credits. And let us know if you want to continue to volunteer for Saturday markets! More info? Email - info@seedsinthemiddle.org
11212.title: Food! Health! Help Brownsville, Flatbush BK kids launch healthy market days!

11213.description: Fiver Children's Foundation is seeking a motivated youth Co-Facilitator in Brooklyn to join the Fiver team and support its mission of empowering the youth through character cultivation year round. Every month, Fiver Children's Foundation hosts Fiver Club, a program where Fiver participants learn character building traits that align with Fiver's three pathways to success: Education and Careers, Service and Leadership, and Healthy Life Choices. Fiver's Youth Co-Facilitator will assist Fiver's Program Supervisor at Fiver Clubs as a support staff by facilitating certain curriculum pieces and handling behavior management. This position is responsible for creating a safe and productive environment, ensuring a high level of program quality, and working to establish a positive relationship with Fiver participants. Fiver's Youth Co-Facilitator will review curriculum with Fiver Program Supervisor prior to the dates of Fiver Club. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to Leading and assisting with curriculum activities and games with Fiver participants that align with Fiver's three pathways to success Supporting the Fiver Program Supervisor Monitoring participants behavior Adequately observing participants activities and enforcing safety regulations and program expectations Qualifications Experience working with the youth, preferably 5th through 8th grade Flexibility Creativity Behavior management and conflict resolution skills Verbal communication skills Leadership and facilitation skills Must be willing to commit to monthly Fiver Clubs on the dates listed below Dates for Fiver Club in Brooklyn, St. Johns Recreation Center Wednesday, March 21st at 4pm - 6pm Wednesday, April 25th at 4pm - 6pm Wednesday, May 16th at 4pm - 6pm Thursday, June 7th at 4pm - 6pm
11213.title: Youth Co-Facilitator in Brooklyn, St. Johns Recreation Center

11213.description: Love soccer? Want to share the joy of the game with underserved kids in central Brooklyn? Join us for this exciting opportuntiy to build a brand new league for youth who need it in Crown Heights! We need players to coach kids ages 3 and up and help lead teams. Most children have never played soccer and some come back every season - so there's a variety of levels. This is a neighborhood with limited healthy options - to eat or get physically fit. So, you'll play a role in not only building teamwork, but empowering youth and families to get active. Seeking anyone who can play soccer or support the program starting now through end of summer. Weekends - Saturdays and Sundays. Thursday evenings also possible. Have fun, play ball, make a difference. Attn, Students! Yes, we give community service credits. Our program started in 2009 just to get kids active. Now, we want to expand a nascent league. . Kids love it, but don't know the game so we need your help. We're also seeking LEAD COACHES, who can set up schedules and organize volunteers and parents. Great experience. Recommendation letters given. Can you play in a fundraising opening soccer game? We can schedule in March! SCHEDULE - April 14 - June 23 SATURDAY, Saturday, April 14 AND SUNDAY, April 15 OPEN FIELD, TRY-OUTS AND TOURNAMENTS APRIL 21 - JUNE 23 SATURDAYS, 1 PM - 3 PM SUNDAYS, 4 PM - 6 PM INFO: No coaching experience needed. Just love of the game and able to collaborate with others. Of course, we'd love it if you have experience... Practices are co-ed, and players range from 3 to 12 years old and are at beginner to intermediate level. If we have enough players, will create boys and girls only teams for ages 10 and up.. If you're self-motivated, love kids and are good with them, can handle the unexpected, and just love this game and want to share it, you're for us. Looking for reliable and flexible players who can commit to at least 2 practices. This is a great community service opportunity for high school and college students. Yes, we do give letters and service hours. WE ASK VOLUNTEERS TO COMMIT TO AT LEAST 2 TIMES ON THE FIELD. If you aren't able to coach, but still want to help, we need folks to: - advertise with flyers, post flyers, drop off flyers at schools and community areas - blast on social media - take attendance and register players - other administrative tasks Please send us information about you- a resume or some information on your background so we get to know you a little to soccer@seedsinthemiddle.org If you have other times you are available - even to do a workshop in a school, let us know. YOU CAN ALSO LIKE US ON FACEBOOK - facebook.com/seedsinthemiddle https://www.facebook.com/brooklyncrown.heightssoccer https://www.facebook.com/Soccer-for-Harmony-204551942961230/ Instagram: @seedsinthemiddle
11213.title: Soccer Players!  Share joy of game, help NEW league for Brooklyn  kids!

11210.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11210.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS K315, Brooklyn)

11211.description: Do you want to: Feel valued as a skilled professional engaged in building a critical, philanthropic arm of a social justice organization? Change lives by expanding the organization’s capacity to serve its clients and achieve justice? Gain experience and contacts in New York City’s legal services community? Become a respected and integral member of a team? If you answered yes, then bring your skills and interest to Brooklyn A to help grow its development and communications department! Established in 1968, Brooklyn Legal Services Corporation A (Brooklyn A) advances social and economic justice and community empowerment through innovative, collaborative, neighborhood-based legal representation and advocacy. We assist individuals, families, community-based organizations, and coalitions in sustaining and developing vibrant, healthy communities. The Development and Communications Volunteer will work as a part of the Development and Communications Team and will assist in executing the annual Development Plan. This is an excellent opportunity to utilize and grow your skills in fundraising, communications and non-profit management. This position is ideal for anyone, particularly recent college graduates, wishing to gain valuable professional experience and learn more about nonprofit development and communications. You don’t need a substantial background in the field, just be excited about our work and eager to learn! Responsibilities of the Development and Communications Volunteer Develop resources to retain existing donors, recapture lapsed donors, cultivate new donors, and increase gift size. Help develop and execute Brooklyn A’s development and communications plan including, but not limited to, generating online content that engages audience segments and leads to measurable results Support the grant proposal development and submission process-ensuring that proposals, reports and other documents are well written, strategic, and submitted on schedule. Assist in creating and executing a strategy for a large, sustained base of individual giving. Who Should Apply? Anyone with: Experience fundraising for local affinity groups, or an interest in learning about them Strong interpersonal communication skills The ability to work independently and as a team player Strong writing and organization skills, as well as creativity The ability to multitask, handling logistics, and following through on multiple projects simultaneously Microsoft Office skills including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint A desire to gain direct experience in and learn more about the nonprofit world! We strongly encourage people of color, of diverse gender identities, women, and LGBT persons to apply.
11211.title: Development & Communications Volunteer

11216.description: Calling all RUNNERS... interested in entering the 2018 TCS NYC Marathon but were not chosen in the lottery? You still can! Children of Promise, NYC (CPNYC), a nonprofit that embraces and empowers children of incarcerated parents, has slots for marathon runners on our 10-person team. To learn more about the benefits of running with Team CPNYC, which includes guaranteed entry into the race, please visit: https://www.cpnyc.org/marathon Run for a reason and raise awareness for a population of children who have an incarcerated parent! ABOUT CPNYC CPNYC is a community-based organization in Brooklyn working to ensure children left behind by prisoners are empowered to break the cycle of intergenerational incarceration and imagine futures bigger and brighter than their current circumstances. All funds raised will go directly toward program support and much needed therapeutic supplies and interventions.
11216.title: Run the 2018 TCS NYC Marathon!

11216.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11216.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 305 Dr. Peter Ray, Brooklyn)

07306.description: CASA volunteers are ordinary people - men and women, retirees and busy professionals - who have the opportunity to directly influence a foster child's life across many significant and far-reaching concerns such as medical care, academics, and enrichment activities. We are looking for individuals with a desire to help children in need of one-on-one attention. The first step to becoming a volunteer is to attend an information session. Please join us for a half-hour to learn how you can make a difference in a foster child's life. Please join us to learn how you can become a volunteer advocate and help improve the lives of foster children!
07306.title: Hudson County CASA Information Session

07305.description: The success of Walk MS is directly related to the wonderful volunteers who dedicate their time to the chapter. We welcome volunteers of all ages, abilities and talents to assist with a variety of volunteer opportunities. There is only one requirement - a desire to see a world free of MS! All Walk MS volunteers receive: Volunteer T-shirt Snacks and beverages Community service hours Plenty of smiles, high fives and thanks! Check out our Walk MS Volunteer Opportunities! Check-In Crew: Volunteers assist in event set-up, register walk-on participants, and hand out T-shirts. 7 AM - 11 PM Cheer Crew: Encourage and cheer-on our event participants. 9 AM - 2 PM Set-up/Break-down Crew: Volunteers will assist with setting up and breaking down tables and chairs, posting signage and moving boxes/other event supplies (must be able to lift boxes, stand for long periods of time and bend). Set-up: 6:30 AM - 11 AM Break-down: 10 AM - 2 PM Entertainers: We’re looking for musicians, DJs, face painters, magicians, clowns, balloon artists and more to donate their time and join the movement. Photographers: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. For more information, visit: www.walkms.org
07305.title: Join the Movement! Volunteer at Walk MS 2018 Jersey City!
07305.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07305.description: Volunteers for our 5th Annual Memorial 5K Race/1Mile Family Walk/Wellness and Concert for American Cancer Fund Charity. Volunteers are needed for setting up pre-race, during the race and post-race duties ranging from handing out race packets/information, helping sign in runners/registration, handing out refreshments, guide vendors and help with music concert. Help clean up of the grounds. We will need you there at 7am until 4:00pm. This is in honor of Mark Lee, Fire Captain for NJ City, First Responder to 911.
07305.title: 5th Memorial 5K Run/ 1Mile Family Walk -Wellness/Music Festival - American Cancer Fund

11215.description: Annual Puppetry Arts 5th Avenue Festival on Saturday April 28, 2017 11:00am-3:00pm with live music, games, and prizes located on 4th Street at 5th Ave along the park at the Old Stone House.Free admission and open to the public and great for kids of all ages -rain or shine! VOLUNTEERS: Help set up the event, run activities with kids, and breakdown SHIFTS: 8am-12noon OR 12pm-4pm FYI: Lunch will be provided Youth Groups 16yo and up welcome Corporate Groups welcome Hours are given for school requirements This fundraising event will support creative arts in educational programs for low income and at risk youth of New York City. For information or to contribute to the organization's mission visit www.puppetryarts.org
11215.title: 5th Avenue Family Festival

11215.description: We are looking for committed volunteers for our school programs! This spring we have two school programs volunteers can help support us with. Our Citizen Science program emphasizes the role of citizen scientists and the importance of advocating for our waterways. Citizen Science program volunteers will become familiar with water quality testing parameters, protocols and help lead groups of students through different tests. Our service-learning program introduces students to the Gowanus Canal, its polluted history and the steps to making a healthier ecosystem through stewardship. Service Learning program volunteers will engage students in stewardship activities - such as gardening, caring for street trees, and propagating plants in our native plant nursery. This is perfect for volunteers that are interested or have prior experience in education. No prior knowledge on topics or activities are needed. Programs are reserved are for Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Based on their availability and interest volunteers can help with one program or both. Volunteers must be able to commit to regularly volunteering throughout the spring season- April till June. Please email education@gowanuscanalconservancy.org if you are interested in one or both school programs.
11215.title: Ongoing Education Volunteer

10035.description: This opportunity is only available Mondays and Tuesdays. The Boys and Girls Club of Harlem is committed to providing access and opportunities for youth to reach their full potential. General Support Volunteers help achieve that goal. The Boys and Girls Club serves members from 5-18 and increasing the adult to member count allows a more meaningful experience for members. Support volunteers allow us to run programs more effectively because there are more individuals to assist in facilitation. Key Responsibilities: Club Support volunteers will assist club staff as well as members to ensure a fun and safe environment for all. This role is to ensure our members are getting the most out of their club experience. Provide programmatic and operational support to the organization. This could be academic support, walking students to different programs and assisting staff with program facilitation.

Come learn how to use your career skills or develop new ones to make a difference in a healthcare setting. To reserve your spot, RSVP by calling 212-889-4805, send an email to info@volunteer-referral.org or sign up at: http://volunteer-referral.com/volunteer-opportunities-in-healthcare-april-19-2018/ ADMISSION IS FREE!
10037.title: Volunteer Opportunities in Healthcare - April 19, 2018  2:00 - 5:00 pm

10036.description: We are in need of a panel of Industry experts in the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering Arts, Math (STEAM) to inspire, motivate, educate students to enter these fields. You will be part of a panel of five or six people speaking about your career and how it relates to STEAM. Students will then be able to ask questions of you. You will need to commit your morning from 9-11 if selected.
10036.title: We Connect The Dots Discovery Day 2018 - Panel Speakers

10036.description: We Connect The Dots' (WCTD) Discovery Day highlights the endless career possibilities offered through careers in STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Math) and also showcases the programs we offer through out the year. What will be expected of me as a volunteer? As a volunteer, you would be expected to help and mentor students by being interactive and supportive during the program when the students need help by having the opportunity to learn how to inspire students to be life-long learners. Some of the examples you may be assigned to do is mentoring students, registration, giving tours of the facility, setting up and cleaning up before and after the program. Do I need any special skills? No, you do not need to have any special skills. Our program incorporates a variety of team building activities that support our goal to engage students to work collaboratively. The result is that by volunteering you will benefit from the experience and come away with valuable skills. To learn more about the opportunity reach out to our team at events@we-connect-the-dots.org, to learn more about the program please visit our website at http://we-connect-the-dots.org/discoveryday2018/ Shifts: (any or all) Monday, April 16th 8:00 am - 3:30 pm Tuesday, April 17th 8:00 am - 3:30 pm Wednesday, April 18th 8:00 am - 3:30 pm
10036.title: Do you enjoy learning along side students?  WCTD's Discovery Day starts the journey.

10036.description: We are hosting a Medicare Scams & Abuse Training for people interested in becoming a Certified Senior Medicare Patrol Instructor! Medicare is a very complex health insurance program, which makes it prone to fraud & scams! This free training will teach: Foundations of Medicare Differences between healthcare Errors, Abuse, & Fraud Common & recent Medicare scams & fraud schemes How to protect yourself & your Medicare Ways to get involved after becoming a Certified Senior Medicare Patrol Instructor! Volunteer Instructors lead workshops on Medicare fraud & Healthcare scams around NYC! For more information, contact Victoria 212-398-6565 ext 235 or vthornton@liveon-ny.org Mission: The New York Senior Medicare Patrol works to empower seniors so that they can protect themselves against healthcare fraud, learn to detect errors on their medical statements and report Medicare abuse when suspected.
10036.title: Medicare Scams & Abuse Training

10036.description: Wanted! Fun, energetic, kid friendly ballet teacher! A basic knowledge of beginner level ballet technique is a must. You would be teaching a class of dancers aged 8-10yrs old.
10036.title: Ballet Teacher for Kids!

10036.description: Health Fair at the Times Square 255 43rd Street, New York, NY 10036 Wednesday, May 16, 2018 11:00am - 1:00pm 5 volunteers needed We are hosting a Health and Sustainability Fair for our residents at our Times Square location, which serves low-income adults, the formerly chronically homeless, and people living with HIV/AIDS. This event is an opportunity to educate our clients on green and healthy living and healthcare in general. For this event, volunteers will be asked to help set up the event space, serve healthy snacks and drinks, demonstrate fitness activities and raffle off prizes.
10036.title: Health Fair at the Times Square

10036.description: The American Liver Foundation Greater New York Division is looking for volunteers to help out at the 2018 Liver Life Walk in New York City! Event duties include: Event Set-up Duties: Assist in hanging banners, setting up tables and chairs, decorating etc. Registration Duties: Welcome participants as they check-in, pick-up their t-shirts and receive detailed information about the day. Parking Attendants Duties: Direct vehicles to empty parking spaces one at a time. There will be an area for volunteers to park separate from participant parking. Also, parking attendants will assist with placing directional signs to designate where the event is being held. Course Set-up Duties: Place route markers and educational signs throughout the walk course approximately every few blocks so walkers/runners are able to stay on the course. Responsibilities also include: 1. Deliver tables, water and cups to water stations 2. Drop-off water station volunteers and course monitors 3. During the Walk, patrol the course to pick-up any tired walkers 4. Follow the final walkers to pick up the course monitors and water stop volunteers 5. Return to the course to pick up the remaining water, cups, tables and signage Course Monitors Duties: As a Course Monitor, you will be stationed at specified intersections along the course to help participants cross any busy intersections and cheer them on to the finish. You might be asked to wear a bright orange vest to distinguish yourself. Greeters Duties: This is every participant's first impression of the event! Greet participants after they have parked and direct them to the registration area. Tent Supervisors Duties: We will be having several tents with food, drinks, games, etc. so we will need people to oversee that everything is going smoothly. Please note: We are happy to provide proof of volunteer time for those who need it for schools, community service, etc. If interested, please contact Logan Moore at lmoore@liverfoundation.org.
10036.title: 2018 Liver Life Walk New York City
10036.org: American Liver Foundation Greater New York Division

10036.description: Come join us as we educate children about healthy eating, food, and taste. Training Dates: Monday, February 26th, 5:30 PM Wednesday, February 28th, 12:00 PM What is Spoons Across America? Spoons Across America (SAA) is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to educating children, teachers, and families about the benefits of healthy eating though food and nutrition-based educational programs for children. What is Agriculture Literacy Week? Spoons Across America is the primary New York City implementer of Cornell Cooperative Extension’s New York Agriculture Literacy Week. In this free program for New York City schools, 1st and 2nd graders learn about New York state agriculture - what kinds of food are grown and produced in the state, and the people who are involved in growing and producing them. Spoons Across America trains volunteers to read a selected storybook and lead a related curriculum activity. Between March 12 and April 25, 2018, volunteers will read Before We Eat: From Farm to Table by Pat Brisson. Students will be taken on the journey from farm to table to understand different aspects of agriculture and the many possible careers involved. This is a captivating glimpse of what it takes to bring the food we eat to us in order to nourish our bodies and spirits. What do Volunteers do? After participating in a hands-on training, volunteers participate in and lead all aspects of Agriculture Literacy Week implementation. Volunteer responsibilities include reading the Agriculture Literacy Week book aloud to the class, leading an activity related to the book, and set up and clean up. We are looking for individuals enthusiastic about healthy eating and children’s programming to join us! Volunteer Training: All volunteers receive training at the Spoons Across America offices (630 Ninth Avenue @ 44th Street in Manhattan), and are required to attend one of the following training dates: Monday, February 26th, 5:30 PM Wednesday, February 28th, 12:00 PM **** Do you work for a business or company that wants to make a volunteer commitment? We can schedule a special training session for groups of 10 or more people, onsite or at our offices. Contact Ali for more information. When do your programs take place? Agriculture Literacy Week programs occur DURING SCHOOL HOURS. Please be advised that there are no after-work hours available for Agriculture Literacy Week. I'm ready to go! How do I sign up? If you are interested in volunteering with Spoons Across America this year, please contact Ali McDowell, Director of Programs and Partnerships, at ali@spoonsacrossamerica.org. In your email, please indicate which training session you will attend: Monday, February 26th at 5:30 PM or Wednesday, February 28th at 12:00 PM. * Please note: Volunteers must complete a background check prior to the program date.
10036.title: New York Agriculture Literacy Week - join us in the classroom!
10036.org: From Farm to Table d/b/a Spoons Across America

10036.description: Love to dance and love working with children! Seeking Intermediate level ballet teacher for an amazing group of talented 8-14yr olds. Basic knowledge of ballet technique is required. Come help teach the awesome kids of the Hell's Kitchen Community!
10036.title: Children's Ballet Teacher!

10036.description: You will have a great time meeting as many people as possible at various events and inviting them to upcoming productions that make a difference and begin crucial conversations.

10036.description: Help rescue some lunch leftovers from an office in Midtown West! We will deliver the food to Travelers Hotel, located at 274 W 40th street. Mediumweight: the average amount of food rescued from this event is 30-45 pounds.
10036.title: End Food Waste and Feed the Hungry Fridays 3PM!

10036.title: Children's Creative Movement Teacher Needed!

10036.description: Theater 315 of the Salvation Army at Times Square, is in need of a Drama teacher for their 2018 semester. You would be teaching acting to a group of about 10 young artists, ages 8-12yrs old, each Wednesday from 6-6:45pm.
10036.title: Children's Drama Teacher Needed!

10036.description: We are in need of a creative movement, beginner modern dance teacher for our Wednesday's youth arts program! Teaching ages 4-6yrs old from 4:00-4:45pm. Love of dance, movement, children, and teaching is a must! Come dance with us!
10036.title: Children's Creative Movement Teacher for Salvation Army

10036.description: In need of a hip hop dance teacher, to instruct our Wednesday night youth programs! Class is from 6-6:45pm, and ages range from 6-12yrs old. Takes place in our Times Square building, in a large beautiful studio with new wooden floors, barres, and mirrors. Love of dance, teaching, and working with kids is a must! Come dance with us!
10036.title: Children's hip hop teacher needed at Salvation Army!

10036.description: The Salvation Army of Times Square is in need of two ballet teachers to instruct our 6-13yr olds. Basic beginner level ballet technique, love of children, and passion for teaching is a must! Starting in Jan. of 2018! We have a beautiful large dance studio with new wooden floors, barres, and mirrors. Come dance with our cute kiddos!
10036.title: Childrens' Ballet Teacher needed at the Salvation Army!

10031.description: The Boys & Girls Club of Harlem’s (BGCHarlem) mission is to provide access and opportunity for youth to reach their full potential as responsible members of the community. We believe that success is within reach of every young person that walks through our doors. Our kids benefit from trained, caring professional staff and volunteers who help them take control of their lives, envision productive futures and reach the goals. Core to this is the development of strong character and leadership skills and we seek your support to both models and encourage them as a volunteer group mentor for our Girls mentoring program. Our Girls mentoring program provides girls ages 8-17, with the skills to develop positive self-esteem, and adopt healthy lifestyle habits. Weekly participants engage in discussions on a range of topics that include media influences on females, dating relationships, and health prevention and education. Volunteers, with the support of BGCHarlem staff, will help to facilitate these discussions over a 10-week session, guiding youth through a curriculum that builds competencies in: Understanding and implementing the Boys and Girls Club of Harlem program Having in-depth and potentially uncomfortable conversations about challenges facing teens today Discussing nutrition, cooking and maintaining a healthy lifestyle. Our Boys Mentoring program uses interactive activities to educate males 8-12 and 13-17 on the critical issues that young men face including decision making, wellness, careers and employment, relationships, and self-esteem This opportunity is on Monday evenings.
10031.title: Boys and Girls Group Mentoring

10030.description: Future Giants is a non profit that has operated in NYC for over 11 years. We specialize in preparing High School students for the social and academic challenges they will encounter after graduation. We have a 100 college acceptance rate and a 99 % on time High School Graduation rate. Last year we created and published a High school book that is being used in several High Schools. We are seeking Volunteers that have a direct or indirect contact with the Mayors of Baltimore and or D.C. It is our hope to recreate our success in those cities as well as open our first multi organization youth center (A.C.E) Future Giants is planning to Launch our Academic + Community = Excellence If you have any contacts with the Mayors of either Baltimore ,MD or D.C ( or the Governor) we would like your assistance in helping thousands of young people achieve their dreams.

10032.description: Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to explore stories and empower their voices. Through our innovative programs, which are part of the class curricula, accomplished authors visit high-needs pre-K-12 classrooms to guide students in creating their own writing and art projects based on the theme of the author's book. You need no experience or training to volunteer. As a classroom coach, you'll support and encourage students as they work on their projects. This workshop needs your help in Washington Heights, NYC. To volunteer, reply with the program code to volunteer@behindthebook.org. We'll supply the address, directions, and other information when you're confirmed: Program 4PKMW-V Date: Wednesday, April 18th Time: 8:45 - 9:30 AM Volunteer Role: Research Coach About the workshop: With Monica Wellington’s Zinnia’s Flower Garden , pre-kindergartners learned about gardening and planting. They’ll conduct hands-on research about the topic by observing and interacting with live flowers in a \"flower museum.\" Using provided questions and sentence-starters, such as what color is this zinnia?, coaches will guide students in engaging with the display, and record their observations. For dates of other workshops around New York City, please visit http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/ To join our team and receive announcements of new classroom programs and other opportunities as they're scheduled, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/
10032.title: Research coach for Washington Heights public school literacy program (4mw)

10989.description: The National MS Society is looking for volunteers to help with our upcoming event - Walk MS: Rockland! Walk MS will be held on Saturday, April 21 at Rockland Lake State Park. Walk MS is a charity walk series that takes place in over 550 locations with more than 300,000 people participating annually. When you participate in Walk MS, you are helping create a world free of multiple sclerosis. Together, we become a powerful force. Together, we will end MS forever. Groups and individuals of all ages and abilities are invited to volunteer. We are always looking for youth clubs, corporate and service-oriented community groups to lend a hand before, during, and after our events. There is only one requirement: a desire to end MS now! If you are interested in volunteering, please review the positions below and register online here: http://walknyn.nationalmssociety.org/site/TR?fr_id=29838&pg=entry Walk MS Rockland - Volunteer Positions Parking Team: Date: Saturday, April 21, 2018 Shift: 7:00 a.m. - 11:00 p.m. Description: Volunteers will help direct incoming participant traffic. If you have any questions, please contact: Sarah Johnston - Specialist, Volunteer Engagement at Sarah.Johnston@nmss.org
10989.title: Parking Volunteers Needed for Walk MS: Rockland!
10989.org: National MS Society - New York City
