10019.description: Be the first face that participants see the morning of AIDS Walk New York! Sign-In Volunteers check in walkers and collect the funds they have raised. You must be friendly, outgoing, detail oriented, and have a valid photo ID. Sign-In Volunteers must be at least 16 years old and fluent in English. AIDS Walk Shift: Sunday, May 20 from 6:45 a.m. - 12:45 p.m. You will receive your Sunday reporting location at orientation. Mandatory Orientation: Tuesday, May 15 from 6:30 p.m. -- 8p.m. at GMHC Event Room (446 West 33rd Street, 6th Floor - Room 6029) OR Saturday, May 19 from 10 a.m. -- 12 p.m. at the Star Walker's Tent in Central Park
10019.title: Sign-In - AIDS Walk New York 2018

10019.description: Together One New York (TONY) is starting a new program to teach Spanish. The volunteering opportunity will generally be weekday evenings between 6 and 9 PM. Prior teaching experience a plus, but certainly not required. TONY is a non-profit organization whose volunteers are passionate about providing vital resources to all members of the NYC community, with a special emphasis on immigrants and language learning. In addition to language classes, we offer a variety of programs such as Citizenship Prep, TASC (high school equivalency), and beginner ESOL conversation. We look forward to expanding our outreach and positively impacting a greater portion of our city's immigrant community.
10019.title: Volunteers needed to teach Spanish language

10019.description: It is difficult and sometimes impossible for seniors to travel by themselves to necessary appointments such as doctors and dentist appointments, and on necessary errands such as food shopping. The Senior Escort program makes these crucial trips possible. Encore’s Senior Escort Program is a volunteer program designed to give much needed assistance and support to aging members of our community. Otherwise, due to physical frailty and disability, vision or hearing impairment, and cognitive problems, our senior neighbors are forced to cancel their trips - which leads to rapid decline in health and quality of life. Things to know: As a volunteer, you will meet the senior at their front door, accompany them to their appointment or errand, and then accompany them back to their home. Trips typically take 1-3 hours, depending on the circumstance. You will travel via public transportation (each individual is responsible for their own metro card) or via cab (the senior participant is responsible for cab fees) The clients we serve live in Manhattan south of 110th Duties include: Helping the older person dress in outerwear such as coat, sweater or hat for the trip Helping the older person lock and unlock his/her residence Helping the older person with physical strains such as assistance on stairs and carrying/pushing the grocery cart Requirements: Commitment of at least 6 months Weekly commitments, preferred Successful criminal background check & reference check Flexible hours Monday-Friday and/or available at least one day a week Attend program orientation & training Must be at least 18 years old Sensitive and empathic with the senior population *Important* Schedule: The program is not a fixed schedule. Requests come in every week, at different times and days Monday-Friday. Volunteers must have flexibility during the work week, i.e. a part-time job, or flexible work hours. It is required that you have at least one entire day free from Monday-Friday, we will place the volunteer on an on-call basis depending on the requests that come in that week. Your role as a volunteer in this program is incredibly valuable and rewarding. Senior program participants are so grateful for your time and help. It is a simple but vital service.
10019.title: URGENT NEED! Encore’s Shop & Escort Program. Accompany Seniors To Medical Appointments. Thank You!

10019.description: Estamos buscando un voluntario para acompañar a un encantador señor de 90+ años. Él vive en la parte sureste de la ciudad de New York. A él le encanta jugar domin ó , mirar noticias y novelas. Él te necesita solo una hora a la semana. GRACIAS. We match isolated and lonely seniors with volunteers in the community who make weekly visits in the senior’s home. The Friendly Visiting program is an opportunity to form rewarding relationships and ongoing companionship for both seniors and volunteers. Seniors and their visitor can converse and enjoy the company, take part in activities like going to cafes and museums, share stories, learn new skills, and a variety of other things based on the desires of the companions. You will be matched with a senior who has a similar personality and interests and you can decide together how to spend your time. Visits can easily fit into your schedule because matches are made based on your availability. We ask for a minimum commitment of 6 months or 1 year. Your time as a friendly visitor is invaluable, and you gain a new friend!
10019.title: Necisitamos Voluntario Para Acompañar Encantador Caballero De 90 Años - Adora Jugar Dominó ¡Gracias!

07650.description: We are running free after schools for children underprivileged in order to give chances for them to get self esteem and confidence in learning. Most of our kids are immigrants who are struggling to settle down in new circumstances. you can teach our children so that they can share what they learn from you with others. Any kind of talent that makes our children and audience happy is greatly appreciated. We have one free after school in Palisades Park and the other in Bergenfield, New Jersey. We will resume 3rd one in Northern Virginia. Classes are from 4:00 PM to 6:10 PM on Monday to Thursday.
07650.title: ESL TEFL TESOL tutoring, Art work for kids

07876.description: The success of Walk MS is directly related to the wonderful volunteers who dedicate their time to the chapter. We welcome volunteers of all ages, abilities and talents to assist with a variety of volunteer opportunities. There is only one requirement - a desire to see a world free of MS! All Walk MS volunteers receive: Volunteer T-shirt Snacks and beverages Community service hours Plenty of smiles, high fives and thanks! Check out our Walk MS Volunteer Opportunities! Check-In Crew: Volunteers assist in event set-up, register walk-on participants, and hand out T-shirts. 7 AM - 11 PM Cheer Crew: Encourage and cheer-on our event participants. 9 AM - 2 PM Set-up/Break-down Crew: Volunteers will assist with setting up and breaking down tables and chairs, posting signage and moving boxes/other event supplies (must be able to lift boxes, stand for long periods of time and bend). Set-up: 6:30 AM - 11 AM Break-down: 10 AM - 2 PM Entertainers: We’re looking for musicians, DJs, face painters, magicians, clowns, balloon artists and more to donate their time and join the movement. Photographers: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. TO REGISTER visit: www.walkms.org
07876.title: Join the Movement! Volunteer at Walk MS 2018 in Roxbury!
07876.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07871.description: Help is needed starting at 8:30AM setting up and picking up to 8:30 PM cleaning up and closing silent auction and 50/50 raffle. In between, help is needed with registration, selling \"Bundles of Fun\", 50/50 tickets, etc. as well as with silent auction and supervising prize holes outdoors on the golf course. Volunteers can help the entire 12 hours or in shifts of 4 or more hours. Volunteers must be 18 years or older. This event raises money to support brain research and student summer fellowships in neuroscience that will lead to cures and treatments for brain diseases such as: Alzheimer's, PTSD, Parkinson's, autism, depression, addiction, epilepsy, MS, traumatic brain injury, brain cancer, etc.
07871.title: IES Brain Research Foundation Golf Outing & Dinner

07018.description: A diverse board of trustees brings added value to the community we serve. We are seeking members with backgrounds in law, education and medicine. Passion for children’s education and well-being a must.
07018.title: Board of Trustees membrr

07017.description: Do you like spending time outdoors? Do you like playing in the dirt? How about smelling the fresh scent of blooming flowers and other plants? If so, then Sierra House has the perfect volunteer opportunity for you! The Sierra House 10th Annual Spring Gardening Event will take place Saturday, May 5, 2018from 10am-2pm at 85 North 14 Street in East Orange, NJ. Join us for a day of fun, friends and gardening. All supplies and lunch will be provided for volunteers. Please contact Halimah at 973-676-6839 or shahilda.boynes@sierrahouse.org with questions or to RSVP for this event.
07017.title: 10th Annual Spring Gardening Event

10314.description: The National MS Society is looking for volunteers to help with our upcoming event - Walk MS Staten Island! Walk MS will be held on Sunday, April 29 at College of Staten Island. Walk MS is a charity walk series that takes place in over 550 locations with more than 300,000 people participating annually. When you participate in Walk MS, you are helping create a world free of multiple sclerosis. Together, we become a powerful force. Together, we will end MS forever. Groups and individuals of all ages and abilities are invited to volunteer. We are always looking for youth clubs, corporate and service-oriented community groups to lend a hand before, during, and after our events. There is only one requirement: a desire to end MS now! If you are interested in volunteering, please review the positions below and register online here: http://main.nationalmssociety.org/site/TR/Walk/NYNWalkEvents?pg=entry&fr_id=29839 Walk MS Staten Island - Volunteer Positions Parking Team: Date: Saturday, April 21, 2018 Shift: 7:00 a.m. - 11:00 p.m. Description: Volunteers will help direct incoming participant traffic. If you have any questions, please contact: Sarah Johnston - Specialist, Volunteer Engagement at Sarah.Johnston@nmss.org
10314.title: Parking Volunteers Needed for Walk MS: Staten Island!
10314.org: National MS Society - New York City

Walk MS is a charity walk series that takes place in over 550 locations with more than 300,000 people participating annually. When you participate in Walk MS, you are helping create a world free of multiple sclerosis. Together, we become a powerful force. Together, we will end MS forever. Groups and individuals of all ages and abilities are invited to volunteer. Volunteers are asked to bring lots of enthusiasm, spirit and cheer! If you have any questions, please contact: Sarah Johnston - Specialist, Volunteer Engagement at Sarah.Johnston@nmss.org

10314.description: The National MS Society is looking for volunteers to help with our upcoming event - Walk MS Staten Island! Walk MS will be held on Sunday, April 29 at College of Staten Island. Walk MS is a charity walk series that takes place in over 550 locations with more than 300,000 people participating annually. When you participate in Walk MS, you are helping create a world free of multiple sclerosis. Together, we become a powerful force. Together, we will end MS forever. Groups and individuals of all ages and abilities are invited to volunteer. We are always looking for youth clubs, corporate and service-oriented community groups to lend a hand before, during, and after our events. There is only one requirement: a desire to end MS now! If you are interested in volunteering, please review the positions below and register online here: http://main.nationalmssociety.org/site/TR/Walk/NYNWalkEvents?pg=entry&fr_id=29839 Walk MS Staten Island - Volunteer Positions Rest Stop Support Team: Date: Sunday, April 29, 2018 Shift: 8:30 a.m. -12:30 p.m. Description: Volunteers will be assigned to one of the rest stops along the route to distribute water and cheer on walkers. If you have any questions, please contact: Sarah Johnston - Specialist, Volunteer Engagement at Sarah.Johnston@nmss.org

10314.description: The Retired and Senior Volunteer program is searching for volunteers, 55 or older, in Staten Island to join our Veterans Support Unit. Needed are volunteers who can assist veterans enrolled in college with their studies by proofreading essays and papers, and/or tutoring in various subjects especially advanced math and science (biology). Most tutoring sessions will be held on campus but virtual volunteering is possible in some cases. Days and hours are flexible. Retirees in the fields of education, nursing and engineering are also needed to serve as career mentors. Please contact Tami DiCostanzo at 347-525-7789 for more information or email tdicostanzo@cssny.org.
10314.title: Retired Teachers/Nurses/Engineers Needed to Help Veterans with College Studies

10314.description: If you 55 years of age or older and looking for a way to stay active and healthy, are newly retired, or just have some free time on your hands - then volunteering is for you. The Retired and Senior Volunteer Program of the Community Service Society is a national program that matches people who want to help, with a volunteer assignment that best suits their skills and interests. The time commitment can be as little as 2 hours a day to several days a week -- depending on how much time you want to share. As a volunteer you can feed the hungry at soup kitchens and food pantries or by delivering meals to homebound elderly. You can visit the sick as a Hospice volunteer or nursing home friendly visitor. RSVP volunteers also help by tutoring children who are having difficulty learning to read, and by preparing adults and recent immigrants for the high school equivalency exam or to find employment. Some volunteers help by providing administrative support at local non-profit organizations, while others assist local museums and cultural institutions as docents. There is usually something for everyone! There are dozens of opportunities right here in Staten Island. To learn more about this program and to see if volunteering is right for you, call 718-494-3222 or email tdicostanzo@cssny.org. A little of your time can make a big difference in someone else’s life.
10314.title: Variety of oppotunities for Older Adults in Staten Island

07011.title: It's not too late to change a life
07011.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

10562.description: AIDSfreeAFRICA collects donated items in several categories (including medical and baby supplies) which are shipped once or twice annually to Cameroon. Items arrive in Ossining, NY without ideal sorting or packing for shipment and use. Several people will work together to repackage and inventory items in one storage location to then be moved to another until shipment. The amount of time any one person works is flexible but should be arranged in advance.
10562.title: Sort and pack items for Cameroon, Africa

07712.description: RunAPalooza is one the Jersey Shore Dream Centers biggest fundraisers of the year! Hosted by the Jersey Shore Running club, the event consists of five races, all benefitting the JSDC and the NJ Chapter of the Special Olympics. Volunteers are needed to help set up and break down, to direct the runners, to offer water along the route and finish line, and of course to cheer the runners on! We will also need runners and/or sponsors. Please come out to help us make a difference in our community!
07712.title: RunAPalooza/Run4Dreams

07712.description: Our annual Safer Garden State 5K is our biggest and more important fundraiser of the year, and we cannot make it happen without the help of dedicated volunteers. We're looking for passionate individuals who will help us on the morning of the event. We need excited and passionate volunteers to stand along the 5K route to cheer on participants and ensure they're following the correct path. Volunteers will receive free admission to the event along with a t-shirt. Join us in creating a safer Garden State!
07712.title: Safer Garden State 5K Volunteer
07712.org: NEW JERSEY COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT

07712.description: DESCRIPTION: Move For Hunger, a national hunger-relief 501(c)3 organization, seeks a dynamic, self-starter interested in learning about new media, also known as social media, communications. This internship is an excellent opportunity to experience how social media is used in a professional, non-profit setting, while working for an exciting young award-winning hunger-relief organization. TIME COMMITMENT Minimum 2-3 days/week Minimum 14 hrs/week in our Asbury Park office REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, Senior, or graduate level students, or recent college graduates Preferred Majors: Communication, Journalism, Media Studies, Digital Communication, Public Relations, Marketing, English, Health Studies, Social Work, Public Health, Non-profit Management, Business Administration MS Office Proficiency Social Media Proficiency Excellent written and oral communication skills Outgoing Personality with outstanding interpersonal skills Interest in learning more about social media strategy DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: This position will work directly with the Communications Manager and Director of External Affairs. Duties and responsibilities will vary from day to day, however, possibilities include the following: Assist in planning and executing social media campaigns Identify and track social media coverage Maintain knowledge of current events and trends within hunger relief and food waste fields Assist in developing social media strategies for a variety of goals Amplify website content through social media posts Assist in developing, organizing, and implementing awareness and giving campaigns Assist program directors with operational initiatives and member communications COMPENSATION: This is an Unpaid/Volunteer internship TO APPLY: Please a send cover letter and resume to intern@moveforhunger.org, with the subject line \" NEW MEDIA COMMUNICATIONS INTERNSHIP\"
07712.title: New (Social) Media Communications Internship | Summer 2018

07712.description: DESCRIPTION: Move For Hunger, a national hunger-relief 501(c)3 organization, seeks a dynamic, self-starter interested in learning about marketing and relationship management to join their Programming Team. The Program Management Intern will help expand the organization’s network of moving companies, real estate professionals, and corporate housing providers by supporting the Programming Team with member recruitment, engagement, participation, communications, and encouraging the network to collect food for communities across the United States and Canada. This internship is an excellent opportunity for a student or professional interested in gaining experience in customer relations, marketing, membership management, and non-profit organizational processes, while working for a young award-winning hunger-relief organization. TIME COMMITMENT: 2-3 days/week Minimum 14 hrs/week in our Asbury Park office REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: College or graduate level students, recent graduates, or professionals looking to change careers MS Office Proficiency Excellent written and oral communication skills Proactive and self-motivated, yet team-oriented Superior organizational skills and attention to detail Outgoing Personality with outstanding interpersonal skills Interest in making a difference in the community DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Duties and responsibilities will vary from day to day, however, possibilities include the following: Assist with recruitment efforts to expand the Move For Hunger network Assist with member retention and participation campaigns Assist with high volume telephone and email communications with new and existing members Data entry, such as recording food donations or researching food banks Writing and executing social media posts Managing, organizing, and executing mailings, including thank you letters and welcome kits COMPENSATION: This is an Unpaid/Volunteer internship TO APPLY: Please a send cover letter and resume to intern@moveforhunger.org, with the subject line \" PROGRAM MANAGEMENT INTERNSHIP\"
07712.title: Program Management Internship | Summer 2018

07712.description: Move for Hunger, a national hunger-relief 501(c)3 organization, seeks a creative, motivated, enthusiastic candidate interested in learning more about professional graphic design. The selected candidate with work directly with the events and communications team to help raise awareness about hunger through event fliers, posters, banners, info graphics, and images for social media. REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: Extensive knowledge and experience with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and Indesign Must be able to work cohesively in a team environment and collaborate Must be organized, detail oriented, and able to meet deadlines Photography, Microsoft Office knowledge, videography, Adobe Premiere, Adobe AfterEffects are a plus A portfolio that showcases your many talents (required with interview) Be open to constructive feedback Working in a team oriented environment Candidate must use his/her own laptop during the course of the internship DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Tasks include but are not limited to: Creating visual content for website and individual posts to our blog/ events section Creating flyers, banners, posters, and marketing materials for food drives and other events Creation of layout and design for internal and external collateral materials Creation of info graphics for social media canpaigns Input into layout redesign of existing material Attending brainstorm sessions and communication/design meetings Adhering to Move For Hunger's brand and style guide Perform additional administrative tasks as needed, assigned by the Art Director TO APPLY: Please send cover letter, resume, and portfolio to intern@moveforhunger.org with the subject line \" GRAPHIC DESIGN INTERNSHIP\"
07712.title: Graphic Design Internship | Summer 2018

07712.description: DESCRIPTION: Move For Hunger, a national hunger-relief 501(c)3 organization, seeks a dynamic, self-starter interested in learning about non-profit administration, to assist with development, marketing, event planning, and communications efforts. This internship is an excellent opportunity to experience various aspects of non-profit administration while working for an exciting young award-winning hunger-relief organization. TIME COMMITMENT: 2-3 days/week Minimum 14 hrs/week in our Asbury Park office REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, Senior, or graduate level students, or recent college graduates Preferred Majors: Communication, Journalism, Media Studies, Digital Communication, Public Relations, Marketing, English, Health Studies, Social Work, Public Health, Non-Profit Management, Business Administration MS Office proficiency Excellent written and oral communication skills Outgoing personality with outstanding interpersonal skills Interest in making a difference in the community DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Duties and responsibilities will vary from day to day, however, possibilities include the following: Help plan and facilitate food drives and fundraisers, incorporating members and media promotion, as appropriate Assist with the identification and development of member engagement opportunities Create, promote, and maintain fundraising campaign Research current trends within the hunger relief and food waste fields Contribute to social media and web site content Assist with events that may occur locally and help recruit volunteers COMPENSATION: This is an Unpaid/Volunteer internship TO APPLY: Please a send cover letter and resume to intern@moveforhunger.org, with the subject line \" EVENT MANAGEMENT INTERNSHIP\"
07712.title: Event Management Internship | Summer 2018

10018.description: DESCRIPTION The Trevor Project is dedicated to recruiting qualified volunteers to provide life-saving, life-affirming support to lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and questioning (LGBTQ) youth. Our volunteers accomplish societal and individual change by creating safe spaces for LGBTQ youth in crisis and promoting awareness of Trevor’s resources. Trevor Lifeline volunteers are trained to answer calls on the Trevor Lifeline from young people who are feeling suicidal or need a safe, non-judgmental place to talk. This is an onsite volunteer opportunity and those interested need to live near our call centers which are located in LA. Time Commitment: **Note: Volunteers must be available for all training dates and times. Lifeline LA and NY Updates Spring 2018 Training: Orientation: Thursday, April 12th | 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM PST and EST Training Dates: April 14-15th, 21-22nd (Sat/Sun) | 9:30 AM - 6:30 PM PST and EST Post-Training: Thursday, May 24th | 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM PST and EST Trevor Lifeline Shift Times (we ask that volunteers commit to two 4-hour shifts per month): Sunday - Tuesday | 1:45pm - 6:00pm EST (New York) / 6:30pm - 11:0pm PST (LA) Wednesday - Thursday | 5:45pm - 10:00pm EST (New York) / 10:30am - 3:00pm PST, 6:30pm - 11:00pm PST (LA) Friday - Saturday | 1:45pm - 6:00pm EST (New York) / 2:30pm - 7:00pm PST, 6:30pm - 11:00pm PST (LA) Required Skills and Qualifications: You are open to constantly learning. You are good at practicing self-care. You fit the profile of an ideal Lifeline volunteer: Genuine Empathetic Non-judgmental Empowering HOW TO APPLY **Please note: You must be at least 18 years old to volunteer. If you are under 18, please consider our Trevor Youth Ambassador Council. For more information, visit our website on trevorproject.org or reach out to our Community Engagement Coordinator Ashley Choi at Ashley.Choi@thetrevorproject.org.
10018.title: Trevor Project NY Lifeline Volunteer

10018.description: Global Green is a national environmental non-profit with offices in NYC, New Orleans, DC and Los Angeles. We're seeking help from a real estate and/or construction sector \"insider\" to provide advice and strategy insight into our programs and next steps with helping to build sustainability in the sector in areas including: - compost use in soil blends for real estate and construction projects - 'circular' materials used by the real estate sector - design for resiliency We'd like to discuss the major opportunities, challenges and opportunities and networks for engagement, education demonstration projects and stakeholder presentations.
10018.title: Real Estate Sustainability Outreach / Research Advisor
10018.org: Coalition for Resource Recovery Global Green USA

10018.description: As climate change increases, one of the expected impacts is that temperatures in some areas will increase, and more generally extreme temperatures will become more likely. This is expected to put increased stress on the demand for heating and cooling - an aspect of energy production that has not gained the same traction as the large gains solar and wind have built in recent years. Global Green is a national environmental non-profit with offices in New Orleans, NYC, Los Angeles and NYC. We're seeking help from a researcher to evaluate market conditions, and best available technologies for renewable heating and cooling as a component of climate resiliency. Global Green is seeking 2-3 volunteers with a focus on: - policy and market conditions research - technology assessment and evaluation Each volunteer opportunity can be structured around the skills and interests of each volunteer while fitting within the larger overall research program. Additionally, we welcome research to be published as authored or co-authored content on Global Green's blog.
10018.title: Renewable thermal and Resiliency Research
10018.org: Coalition for Resource Recovery Global Green USA

10018.description: Every Seed Planted Helps a Flower Grow! As a Seed Coach you will form a one-to-one advising relationship with a young woman of color to transform her passion and dreams into a powerful story for her resume and college essay. Seeds of Fortune, Inc. executive and Seed Coach team is a dynamic community of young professional women on a mission to provide creative and academic guidance, support, and opportunities for the next generation. Seed Coaches for the 2017-18 program will be provided 3 H.S scholars to work with throughout the summer and fall. TO QUALIFY AS A SEED COACH, YOU ARE: Equipped with at least two years of professional experience and great writing skills Ready to commit to Attendance at Boot Camp Digital once a week bi-weekly one-to-one writing and college sessions (Sept-Nov) Monthly in-person SEED workshops (Sept-Dec), and other special events Prepared to maintain clear and frequent communication with Seeds of Fortune, Inc.’s Program staff and your Scholar Eager to share in our mission to empower the next generation of women of color ​ AS A SEED COACH, YOU CAN EXPECT:​ To become an essential part of a young girl finding her voice Training and ongoing guidance as you build her college application Frequent communication with compassionate and knowledgeable staff and experienced volunteers An opportunity to grow with a dynamic community, and team retreat
10018.title: Seed Coach

10018.description: Help us rescue catered leftovers from 3 Midtown offices (2 of the offices are in the same building)! This event will end at Traveler's Hotel, located at 274 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018. Medium weight: the average amount of food rescued from this event is 30-50 pounds.

07746.description: This is NOT AN ENTRY LEVEL POSITION. Experience is a must. This is currently an UNPAID opportunity for a volunteer or intern . This is predominantly a virtual opportunity but candidate must live locally . Seeking an EXPERIENCED design-oriented, creative, and sharp individual to help build and manage a young upcoming entertainment artist's brand across social media. Responsibilities and Duties Prior to applying visit www.bgcme.org to complete an online application and learn more about our organization . This is an excellent opportunity for the right candidate to develop a proven track record of driving organic business growth via social media. If You: are interested in a career in the entertainment industry are obsessed with social media have an eye for fun, clean, and inspiring design are active across social media Then this is the opportunity for you! Responsibilities and Duties: Take photo and videos of young artist for website and social media. Design, create, and publish content across channels including Facebook, Instagram,Twitter, and possibly SnapChat and Pinterest appropriate for a youth artist. Lead social media efforts and develop strategies to tell the artist's brand story in exciting and fresh ways using videos and pictures. Identify and build influencer partnerships to propel the upcoming artists movement nationwide. Gain interests in artist from directors, record labels, celebrities, and more which lead to securing work for artist. Strategize our social media campaign to gain artist's exposure and manage a daily and weekly content calendar Stay on top of social media trends and identify and build partnerships with brands and influencers Monitor social media accounts and create strategies that drive growth Create press releases for newsworthy stories and send them to the relevant media outlets, help develop interest and relationships with media contacts If interested: Complete an online application at bgcme.org/jobs, email your resume and cover letter to the email on our website. Qualifications and Skills Qualifications: Marketing: 3 years Social Media and Social Media Marketing: 3 years Outstanding communication (both verbal and written) skills Well-versed in organic growth strategies on social media Experience working with youth Skills: Provide links to 2-5 social networking profiles to demonstrate interest and knowledge Possess skills in leadership, writing, presentation, interpersonal relations, and management Perform well in environment that values creativity, flexibility, and variety Exhibits personal qualities, such as open-mindedness, enthusiasm, and adaptability Prefers challenges, fast pace, new ideas, future focus, and unstructured environment Must demonstrate experience working independently with a great level of autonomy
07746.title: Social Media Associate/Public Relations - For Young Artist

10013.description: LearningSpring School, a K-8 non-profit school for children on the autism spectrum, is seeking volunteers for its annual LSS Blooms Benefit on Thursday, April 19th. This year we will be honoring Robert Manfred, Commissioner of Baseball, on behalf of Major League Baseball’s commitment to autism awareness. We need volunteers to help during the event. The event shift is 5:30 PM -to 9:30 PM (dinner will be provided). Volunteer tasks (during the event): Help with check-in and raffle sales Watch over the Silent Auction table Assist guests with finding their seats Help facilitate the live Home Run Appeal (i.e. noting guests who have raised paddles to signify a pledge) Bidding For Good tech support Attire: Volunteers should wear black business casual clothing (i.e. woman- a black dress, skirt, or black dress pants with a black blouse or top; man- black dress pants with a collared shirt). Please note: All volunteers must be at least 21 years old. For more information, please contact Cara Flynn (Development Coordinator) at cflynn@learningspring.org. To sign up please contact Cara by Wednesday, April 11th.
10013.title: Spring benefit event volunteers

10013.description: Welcome summer in NYC’s backyard playground! Help support the Park's premiere summer fundraising event involving a BBQ and cocktails, kids entertainment and live music along Hudson River Park’s sparkling waterfront to support the Park’s ongoing free programming for families and children, ensuring a fun and enriching experience for all. Entryway/Greeter Volunteers - Greeting guests, directing attendees toward check-in, and providing basic event information Check-In Volunteers - Greet guests, hand out wristbands to attendees after check-in, ensure all attendees sign waivers, and general guest management Curated Care - Support Curated Care staff as needed Super Soccer Stars - Support Super Soccer Stars staff as needed Bubble Dad - Support Bubble Dad staff as needed Big City Fishing - Support Environment and Education staff as needed Face Painting - Line control, manage waiting guests and ensure organization Stroller Parking - Encourage guests to leave strollers, highlight that volunteers will not be responsible for watching strollers (leave at own discretion) Info Table - Distribute collateral, answer guest questions, and direct partners Perimeter Marshalls - Ensure/direct all guests to use main entrance at check-in, answer basic event questions, and block key entryways
10013.title: Hudson River Park Friends Backyard BBQ

10013.description: For many new immigrants, learning English is a first step to full participation in American society. Help them take that first step by becoming a volunteer teacher in English or Citizenship classes. English classes help students improve their communication skills. Citizenship classes help students prepare for the U.S. citizenship test. Volunteers work in teams to plan lessons and teach the class. This fun and rewarding experience gives you a chance to make a difference in the lives of others. Individuals with an interest in education careers are encouraged to apply. Requirements Must have good communication skills and a strong desire to help and work with new immigrants Prior teaching experience is preferred. Bilingual skills are a plus. We prefer volunteers who can commit to teaching at least two semesters Prospective volunteers must complete application and be interviewed. Volunteer Schedule: 9:30 am-11:30am (Tues or Thurs) 10:30 am-12:30 pm (Tues or Thurs) 1pm to 4pm (Saturday) 6:30pm to 8:30 pm (Mon, Tues or Wed) Spring 2018 - February 27, 2018 to June 7, 2018 Summer 2018 - July 9, 2018 to August 18, 2018 Prospective volunteers must complete application and will be interviewed. Please contact us at cpanyc@cpanyc.org for an application OR apply on-line here: http://bit.ly/volunteerteacherapplication For more information: http://bit.ly/VolunteerToTeachEnglishorCitizenshipClass
10013.title: Teach English or Citizenship Class in Chinatown

10013.description: Help rescue catered lunch leftovers from 2 offices in Greenwich Village! We will deliver the food to NYC Rescue Mission, located at 90 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10013. Mediumweight: the average amount of food rescued from this event is 25-50 pounds.
10013.title: Fight Food Waste in Greenwich on Fridays 3:30PM!

10013.description: VOLUNTEER NEEDED FOR OUR MANHATTAN OFFICE INSIDE OF FEDCAP. DUTIES: --Greet the client --Explain that we take pictures and they have to sign a waiver [(we can cut their heads off on the picture, should they not want to be seen) Not mandatory for receiving services] --Measure assist them in tying a tie (if they do not know how) finding a suit, shirt, slacks, shoes, etc. that fits. (They can try on the clothing in the restroom.) --Arrange for the hemming of pants or the sewing on of buttons with the tailor and set a date for the client to pick up the tailored items. If no alterations are needed, then fold up the items and place in a bag for the client. --Keep records of activities and calls in the log. --Be able to work alone, with minimal supervision or with others We are doing one day a week, for now (date to be discussed), but the time will be 10 AM to 3 PM. This is a great opportunity for anyone wanting to go into law enforcement and who wants to see \"the other side\" after a person comes home, someone that wants to be in the fashion industry, or social services/non-profit sector. You will be networking with everyday people, politicians, individuals from different programs (formerly incarcerated individuals, etc.), City organizations/programs, and pastors. There is a possibility that you will be helping with administrative work and our events as well. You must be neat and presentable. We also will need you to assist in pop-up shops and the occasional donation pick up. Check out what we do to get a better feel for 100 Suits http://www.100suits.org/100-suits-speaks Please be reliable! SERIOUS INQUIRIES ONLY!!!
10013.title: Fashion and Justice Volunteer (Queens)

10013.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premier human services providers, is a 123-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated services which significantly improve the lives of 15,000 people in need each year on the East Side of Manhattan. Our Senior Center at East 54th Street and Lexington Avenue is a vibrant program that provides hundreds of older adults with educational, cultural, health and social activities every week. We are seeking instructors for a variety of classes and activities including: Zumba Chair Yoga Mah Jong Line Dancing Conversational Italian Book Discussion Group Digital Photography Instructors lead their respective classes/activities once per week on weekdays. If you have one of the skills above and are interested in sharing your time and knowledge with active and enthusiastic older adults please contact Anthony Snowden, Volunteer Director at asnowden@lenoxhill.org or 212-218-0487.
10013.title: Instructor for Senior Center

11231.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 6-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. Responsibilities: Assisting the PR Coordinator or Director with any work towards the organization. Creating templates, emails, documents, etc for the Director/Coordinator. Reaching out on social media, posting pictures, hashtagging, tweeting, posting on Facebook etc. The ability to communicate properly and professionally with other volunteers/interns and prospective sponsors, donors. Overall Responsibilities: -Assisting Director/Coordinator with any emails, research, postings for social media. -Creating documents for the department potentially sharing this information with everyone. -Thinking of new and creative ideas for social media. -Reaching out whether on Facebook, Pinterest, Instagram, Twitter, to donors/sponsors etc. -Understanding email etiquette. -Must support and maintain mission goal and statement of organization. -Familiarizing themselves with social media, magazine, brochures. -Working with Wordpress, C++, etc for social media. -Creating templates for the PR Department. Competencies: -Knowledge of all social media -Ability to learn and consistently change with the organization. -Computer based knowledge. -Knowledge of Google. -Knowledge of Microsoft Office .
11231.title: Public Relations Assistant

10011.description: Housing Works is powered by a vibrant community of volunteers who lend their time, dedication, and passion to many different roles within our non-profit organization.By volunteering, you are directly responsible for providing funding to and advocating for New Yorkers affected by homelessness and HIV/AIDS. Thank you for your interest in volunteering at Design on a Dime 2018. We are thrilled to announce that this is our 14th annual Design on a Dime! Last year’s event was a huge success, raising over $1.2 million for homeless New Yorkers living with and affected by HIV/AIDS. The event featured the industry’s top interior designers who created unique room vignettes using items donated from over 100 furniture designers, artists, brands, and individuals. You can find out more about our event here: http://doadnyc2018.splashthat.com/ Each year, DOD depends on the hard work of hundreds of volunteers, and right now we are looking for folks that are comfortable with heavy lifting to help us load in all the awesome furniture and art to be used to create our beautiful vignettes on Tuesday, April 24th from 10 am to 2 pm. PLEASE NOTE: Although we will be providing dollys, volunteers must be lifting and comfortable working with about 40 to 50 pounds All participating volunteers will receive a brand new Design on a Dime 2018 t-shirt along with a 25% discount card to be used during our Public Sale Days or at one of our Thrift Shops (valid for 30 days). If you are interested in volunteering, or would like to sign up your group to volunteer please email volunteers@housingworks.org.
10011.title: LOOKING FOR VOLUNTEERS TO HELP WITH HEAVY LIFTING!

10011.description: Yamba Malawi is planning our largest fundraiser of the year, Gala for Good, on Tuesday, April 24th at IAC in New York City. Each year, Gala for Good features an open bar and tastings by New York's top restaurants, gathering approximately 500 guests. More than just a cocktail party, this event raises $10 for every $1 spent. We are seeking approximately 15 New York-based volunteers (aged 21+) who will assist with setup and breakdown, registration, and the live auction at the event. Once the program has concluded, you are invited to enjoy the rest of the event as our guest. If you are unavailable for the entire event but would still like to help, there will be a volunteer craft night two weeks prior (date TBD), where we will prepare goodie bags, signage, etc. for the event. Interested individuals should email PoLin So at info@yambamalawi.org. Please include which volunteer opportunity you're in interested in, why you'd like to volunteer with us and, if applicable, what event experience you may have.
10011.title: Event Volunteers (21+) for Nonprofit Gala

10011.description: The Salvation Army has been meeting the needs of individuals in the New York City area for over 125 years. To meet the ever increasing needs in our communities, The Salvation Army relies on the vast and varied talents of hundreds of volunteers to make our operations run smoothly. Presently, we are seeking a detail-orientated volunteer to help with administrative support and data entry. Please consider joining our team where you will enjoy working in a professional, comfortable work environment at our Administrative Headquarters in the Chelsea section of Manhattan.
10011.title: Admin Support/Data Entry
10011.org: The Salvation Army of Greater New York

10011.description: The Children’s Tumor Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to funding critical research that will one day end neurofibromatosis. In addition to benefiting those who live with NF, this research is also shedding new light on several forms of cancer, brain tumors, bone abnormalities, and learning disabilities, ultimately benefiting the broader community. The Children’s Tumor Foundation also supports people living with NF and their families with accurate, current and readily accessible information, and assists in the development of clinical centers to create better access to quality healthcare. We are in need of several committee members to join our team of NF Walk Organizers! The role of the committee member may be: To partner with and support the event chair in planning the event within the community. Help motivate, recruit and retain the participants. Communicate with the event Chair on a regular basis and be proactive in the community promoting the event. Assist with logistics and pre-event planning. Securing donations for a raffle, picnic and fundraising. Recruit and organize event-day volunteers. Assist with event-day activity planning and management and post event wrap up. Join the CTF Volunteer Team and see what a difference one person can make! Event site: https://join.ctf.org/event/2018-nf-walk-nyc/e163860
10011.title: New York Charity Walk Committee Members Needed - NYC

10011.description: GRANT WRITER The Grant Writer is primarily responsible for developing and writing grant proposals to foundations and other grant-making organizations, and will persuasively communicate CSP's mission and programs to potential funders. Reporting to the Executive Director, the Grant Writer will assemble and submit grant requests, establish and maintain personal contact and relationships with foundation contacts, conduct prospect research, and maintain a calendar of submissions and other deadlines. To get a response please send RESUME.
10011.title: Grant Writer

10011.description: Education Program Coordinator - Chelsea Sculpture Park. New York , New York. Basic Requirements: BA or MA in related discipline required (Art Education) Post college professional work experience required Demonstrated experience with art education or other informal art programming and curriculum design Demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft computer programs and excellent presentation skills Job Responsibilities: Coordinate and develop of new partner-institution/organization relationships and curriculum Provide leadership and direction towards the design and implementation of art educational programming and curriculum in compliance with national and state learning objectives, accreditation guidelines, and innovative art methodologies Establish and grow professional relationships with constituents, peers, associations and partner schools To Apply: Please submit your resume with cover letter and references to the contact information listed below. Set against the backdrop of the Hudson River, Chelsea Sculpture Park will offer fine art for the public to experience, up close and outdoors. The park's mission is to provide an aesthetic oasis in the Chelsea Cove section of Hudson River Park located between 22nd and 26th Streets, just steps away from the world-class Chelsea Art District. We are looking for a Education Program Coordinator to assist the founder and executive-director of Chelsea Sculpture Park develop and implement an educational program foccusing on the exhibitions of the sculpture park.
10011.title: Educational Program - Coordinator

10011.description: Chelsea Sculpture Park New York, New York Are you considering a future in arts administration, nonprofit management, fundraising, arts education or a related field? This is a great opportunity to gain experience working at a brand new nonprofit arts organization that is dedicated to building a sculpture park on the banks of the Hudson River Park. Gain invaluable insights and learn fundraising strategies as part of a dynamic Development team. Assist with prospect research, special events, direct mail, and our donor database, as well as pursue special projects. Internship credit may be arranged through your academic program. The ideal candidate will be organized and detail-oriented, and have good computer skills. Those with prospect research experience and graduate students in arts administration and arts education are especially welcome. The hours for this position are flexible within the work week. A modest stipend is available. To Apply: Please be sure to include current contact information so that we may arrange an interview. To get a response please send RESUME .
10011.title: Development Intern

10011.description: The Children’s Tumor Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to funding critical research that will one day end neurofibromatosis. In addition to benefiting those who live with NF, this research is also shedding new light on several forms of cancer, brain tumors, bone abnormalities, and learning disabilities, ultimately benefiting the broader community. The Children’s Tumor Foundation also supports people living with NF and their families with accurate, current and readily accessible information, and assists in the development of clinical centers to create better access to quality healthcare. We are in need of an event chair to lead our organizational committee! Position Summary: Serve as the Lead Event Organizer, overseeing the event from beginning to end. Organize/recruit, motivate and lead a committee of other volunteers as they recruit teams, obtain sponsorship, and plan the event details. Roles and Responsibilities Work with Operations Chair and Staff Partner to follow all Children’s Tumor Foundation policies and procedures as well as state laws and local ordinances as well as the program standards. Know and be able to articulate the CTF mission, vision and messaging points. Recruit volunteer committee leads to manage the various aspects of the event (such as: Media & Publicity, Logistics, Operations, Recruitment, Event Volunteers). Work with Staff Partner to schedule committee meeting dates, develop agendas and facilitate committee meetings. Monitor progress of committee chairs through regular communication to ensure tasks are completed. Enforce accountability with committee members for assigned tasks and the overall event goals. Adhere to pre-approved budget through work with Staff Partner. Assist with identification of the appropriate person to succeed you as Chair. Arrange for appropriate recognition of sub-committee members and event day volunteers. Preferred Skills and Experience: Previous fundraising event organization is preferred but not essential. Organizational skills including general organizing, planning, time management, scheduling, coordinating resources and meeting deadlines. Comfort speaking in front of a group or potential sponsor Excellent communication skills Ability or experience overseeing the work of others. Spreadsheet and/or Google Drive knowledge and experience is a plus. Event site: https://join.ctf.org/event/2018-nf-walk-nyc/e163860

11233.description: Memorial Day BBQ at the Domenech 1505 St Marks Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11233 Thursday, May 24, 2018 12:00 - 4:00pm 3 volunteers needed Home to a mix of formerly homeless and low-income, single seniors , the Domenech is having their annual Memorial Day BBQ. Our volunteers will be asked to help decorate, man the grill, and serve our residents, many of whom have difficulty getting around.

11233.description: Spring Planting at the Domenech 1505 St Marks Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11233 Thursday, April 26, 2018 2:00 - 5:00pm 10-12 volunteers needed The Domenech in Brownsville, will be hosting their Spring Planting Event. The Domenech is home primarily formerly homeless, and low-income seniors. Volunteers for this event will help us to continue to provide our residents with beautiful living spaces both inside and out. We hope you’ll join us for the spring planting event, but be prepared to get your hands dirty, as we plan on and need help changing the soil in the raised planters in the back yard. Volunteers will be assisting us with digging up many pounds of soil in 6 beds, bagging the old dirt up, and then replacing it, all to take place before the actual planting. We’re looking for a group of 10-12 volunteers to help us with this special project.
11233.title: Spring Planting at the Domenech

11235.description: Our Brighton Beach food pantry helps individuals in the community experiencing food insecurity. We serve many seniors, immigrants, and Holocaust victims. Volunteers assist food pantry clients with ordering food on an iPad. This allows clients to select which food items they want and do not want for their family, giving them more choice and autonomy, and also reducing food waste. Dates: (with the option for coming only once or on a repeating-basis, depending on what best suits your schedule) Thursday April 12 Thursday April 19 Thursday April 26 We will also be having a makeup day on the Tuesday April 17th Times: 9:15 - 1:30 Location: The pantry is located directly off the Brighton Beach stop on the B/Q line. The head of the pantry always orders a free lunch for everyone assisting. If you are interested in volunteering, please email ndehart@metcouncil.org for further details!

10014.description: The ALS Association Greater New York Chapter needs YOUR help! With the 2018 New York City Walk to Defeat ALS approaching, we hope you will be able to volunteer with us to help make this year’s Walk a success. Almost 190 walkers have raised over $40,000 dollars to date! We need your help on the day of the event to ensure that everyone has a great experience. Because of the energy and support that our volunteers provide on the day, our walkers come back year after year to enjoy the Walk! When: Saturday, May 5 th Where: Hudson River Park at Pier 45 Registration opens at 9:00AM, opening ceremonies are at 10:30AM and the Walk begins at 11:00AM, so we’ll need people to volunteer before and/or during the Walk. You can pick whichever time slot that would work best for you! We can provide up to 6 hours of community service! _________________________________________________________________________ If you are interested, please email vjung@als-ny.org with: 1. Full Name (and those volunteering with you) 2. Walk(s) you would like to volunteer at 3. Cell Phone # 4. What time slot between 8:00AM-1:00PM are you available? (Time slots include 8AM-11AM, 11AM-1PM, 8AM-1PM) 5 . Do you have any physical limitations? 6. Are you (or anyone with you) under 18? *If under 18, we need to have a signed permission slip prior to volunteering _________________________________________________________________________ Positions include**: Registration Food Parking Marshal Walk Marshal Water Station T-Shirts Kids Zone Tribute Banner Cheer Photographer Assistant Early Bird Set-Up **will be chosen based on availability and time commitment If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Vivian Jung at 212-720-3043 _________________________________________________________________________ You can register for the Walks at alswalks.org or call Meg Emery at 212-720-3049 Interested in becoming a local partner? Learn more about our Chapter's Corporate Partnership Opportunities and the impact your company can have right here in our community. Contact Jillian Saperstein 212-720-3052 | jsaperstein@als-ny.org

10014.description: GO Project: Who We Are and What We Do The GO Project shapes the futures of low-income New York City public school children by providing critical academic, social and emotional support starting in the early elementary years. GO provides year-round educational and family support services to children who are performing below grade level and equips them with the confidence and skills needed to succeed at school, at home and in life. GO School Tutoring: How YOU Can Help During the GO School Saturday program, a professional teacher models a lesson, activity, or project to a classroom of students. Volunteer tutors continue to work with small groups of 2-4 students on the lesson, providing individualized attention which allows the students to thrive. Tutor Responsibilities Tutor small group of students in grades 1st-8th who are in need of academic intervention under Head Teacher’s guidance Punctual and consistent attendance; no more than 3 absences permitted per session (Session I: October-December, Session II: January-April) Actively and enthusiastically participate - support instruction and engagement Help prepare, record, and put away classroom materials Ongoing communication with Head Teacher regarding students’ progress and/or concerns, and with the Senior Director of Community Engagement regarding overall volunteer experience Time Commitment Session I: October-December 2017; 9 Saturdays from 9:00AM-12:45PM Session II: January-April 2018; 14 Saturdays from 9:00AM-12:45PM Attend mandatory orientation and training prior to start of session. *You can choose to be a Committed Volunteer to come each Saturday with 3 allowed absences per session, or a Floater Volunteer to come on the Saturdays that you are available. GO School Fall 2017 Session I October 14, 21, 28 November 4, 11, 18 December 2, 9, 16 GO School Spring 2018 Session II January 6, 20, 27 February 3, 10, 24 March 3, 10, 17, 24 April 7, 14, 21 Locations You can choose to tutor our students at one of the following 6 locations: Manhattan Locations Avenues: The World School (1st-5th Grade): 259 10th Avenue, between 25th and 26th Streets Grace Church School (1st-5th Grade): 86 4th Avenue, between 10th and 11th Streets Grace Church High School (6th-8th Grade): 46 Cooper Square, at 6th Street LREI (1st-5th Grade): 272 6th Avenue, at the corner of Bleecker Street St. Luke’s School (1st-3rd Grade): 487 Hudson Street, at Hudson and Christopher Streets Brooklyn Location Berkeley Carroll (1st- 2nd Grade): 701 Carroll Street, between 6th and 7th Avenues Placement is based on a complimentary match between programmatic need and volunteer strengths. We will honor preferences when possible. Qualifications College students, professionals, retirees, and high school students in good academic standing Commitment to and belief in all children’s ability to succeed and thrive Professional work habits Benefits: How Can We Help YOU Personal gratification through enhancing the lives of young learners Ongoing professional development and training opportunities Leadership opportunities for sustained dedication and commitment Being part of a vibrant and diverse volunteer community How to Apply Application Form Cover Letter/Personal Statement explaining why you want to volunteer with GO Project Resume (for volunteers 18 and older)/High school transcript (for high school students) Personal reference Background check (for those 18 and older) If interested, please fill out the online form at: https://goo.gl/forms/iGs9YOzEUsNCujrk2. The online application form can also be found on our website at: http://goprojectnyc.org/get-involved/volunteer. If you have any questions or would like more information about the available volunteer positions, please contact volunteering@goprojectnyc.org or call 212-533-3744 ATTN: Olivia Nunez, Senior Director of Community Engagement.
10014.title: Help a Child Love to Learn on Saturday Mornings!

10474.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
10474.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 48 Joseph R. Drake, NYC)

11433.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11433.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 48 William Wordsworth, Queens)

10004.description: Founded in 1990, the New York Legal Assistance Group uses the power of the law to help New Yorkers in need combat social and economic injustice. We address emerging and urgent legal needs with comprehensive, free civil legal services, impact litigation, policy advocacy, and community education. Position Description: NYLAG seeks a summer volunteer for the Pro Bono & Volunteer (PBV) Unit. The PBV Unit collaborates with community organizations and engages pro bono attorneys and volunteers to serve a greater number of people with unmet civil legal needs. This unit coordinates the recruitment and management of NYLAG’s robust in-house and pro bono volunteers. The Language Access Volunteer Program (LAV) is a new NYLAG initiative that recruits volunteers to serve as on-call interpreters for NYLAG staff. This program was created to ensure that language barriers do not keep low-income populations from getting quality legal assistance. In addition to projects from PBV, the Volunteer Assistant would also help recruit volunteers and manage the LAV Program. Responsibilities will include: Recruit LAV volunteers for in-demand languages Respond to prospective applicants and conduct phone screen interviews Manage a comprehensive database of LAV volunteer information Track legal volunteers from NYLAG’s One-Day Legal Clinic programs Coordinate and attend in house legal trainings for attorneys and summer interns Provide administrative support for PBV Unit This is an excellent opportunity to gain exposure to a fast-paced non-profit legal environment while getting hands on experience in the techniques and strategies of volunteer management. Qualifications: Minimum: Current college student Spanish fluency strongly preferred Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Excellent verbal and written communication skills Experience with Excel or other databases Ability to quickly learn new programs and skills Passion for our mission to help low-income New Yorkers Commitment: Time frame: May 29 th to August 3 rd(flexible) 3-5 days a week, flexible hours To Apply: Email resume and cover letter detailing relevant experience to volunteer@nylag.org with \"PBV Summer Volunteer\" in the subject line.
10004.title: Summer volunteer for the Pro Bono & Volunteer (PBV) Unit

10004.description: A Let’s Get Ready Access Coach is a volunteer position for current undergraduate college students or recent graduates interested in supporting high school students from low-income households through SAT preparation and college admissions guidance, many of whom will be the first generation to attend college. Let’s Get Ready Coaches are a part of a network of approximately 1,000 college students per year working together to help students build confidence to tackle the SAT and get to and through college. Coaches are expected to commit to: At least one night a week (3 hours) of direct tutoring and mentoring with a group of 5-7 high school students 1.5 hours a week to prepare for each week’s lesson and to communicate with students about homework questions, attendance reminders, and other support. Let’s Get Ready provides training and ongoing support for all of its Coaches. Initial training is based around the SAT, its structure, and how to effectively engage a classroom of high school students. Secondary trainings are conducted by Let’s Get Ready Site Directors and focus on how to improve and give Coaches a chance to highlight some aspects of their role that are going really well. Throughout programming, Let’s Get Ready staff supports Coaches with a variety of resources and professional development opportunities as well as in-person observations and feedback. Let’s Get Ready also provides lesson plans for each week of programming. We encourage coaches to be innovative and creative when implementing lesson plans and tailoring classes to the skill level of the students. Position Responsibilities: Classroom Management and SAT Preparation Provide SAT preparation (either Math or Writing and Language) to a group of 5 to 7 high school students from low-income families Use classroom management techniques to keep students engaged in each lesson Prepare lessons for each class night, taking into account student needs and areas of growth Communication and Relationship Building Consistently communicate with students outside of class to help with homework completion and overall engagement in the program Work effectively with Site Directors and fellow Coaches throughout the program to build a strong network of leadership for your students Engage with all students throughout programming to not only build, but maintain strong relationships Help foster a college success culture through Let’s Get Ready’s College Choice curriculum College Admission Support Engage students in conversations centered around college by guiding them through the College Choice Checklist Encourage a college-going culture in the classroom Lead weekly activities and discussion about the college admissions process Support the initial phases of developing a college essay Who we look for: Let’s Get Ready seeks passionate individuals who are committed to the mission of providing educational resources and support to all students. Our Coaches are team players, focused on doing whatever it takes to help students gain the confidence that is needed to begin the college-going process. Questions? Contact zsmolen@letsgetready.org. Apply online at https://www.tfaforms.com/4658529
10004.title: Calling all college students who are passionate about education & mentorship!

10004.description: The New York Legal Assistance Group (NYLAG) seeks an undergraduate or graduate student to serve as a Special Events and Fundraising Volunteer in our Development Unit. The New York Legal Assistance Group (NYLAG) provides free civil legal services to low-income New Yorkers. NYLAG clients include immigrants, seniors, the homebound, families facing foreclosure, renters facing eviction, low-income consumers, those in need of government assistance, children in need of special education, domestic violence survivors, persons with disabilities, patients with chronic illness or disease, low-wage workers, low-income members of the LGBT community, Holocaust survivors, and others in need. DEVELOPMENT We are a small but mighty team seeking to further NYLAG’s mission by growing our individual and corporate revenue. We seek a highly organized and detail-oriented intern to support all aspects of fundraising, including supporting donor communications, gift acknowledgement, and special events. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone interested in learning the ins and outs of nonprofit fundraising in a fun, supportive, and fast-paced environment. Responsibilities Provide administrative support to the Development Team Support the fundraising team in executing our annual Gala in May 2018 Assist with donor acknowledgement and data entry Perform other administrative duties as assigned Qualifications Commitment of 2 days in office per week, 8-12 hours for at least 3 months Interest in learning about nonprofit fundraising Positive attitude and self-motivated Professional demeanor and punctuality To Apply: Email resume and cover letter to volunteer@nylag.org with \"Development Volunteer\" in the subject line.
10004.title: Special Events and Fundraising Volunteer

10004.description: The New York Legal Assistance Group (NYLAG) has an opening for a volunteer within its General Administrative Unit (GAU ). The New York Legal Assistance Group (NYLAG) provides free civil legal services to low-income New Yorkers. NYLAG clients include immigrants, seniors, the homebound, families facing foreclosure, renters facing eviction, low-income consumers, those in need of government assistance, children in need of special education, domestic violence survivors, persons with disabilities, patients with chronic illness or disease, low-wage workers, low-income members of the LGBT community, Holocaust survivors, and others in need. GAU/Administrative Clerk Team The Administrative Clerk Team plays an important role in performing routine clerical and organizational tasks. There’s never a dull moment as there is always something for everyone to complete. Administrative Volunteer Position While the position is mainly administrative and clerical work, the volunteer will have exposure to the provision of free legal services. Responsibilities Providing administrative support to the Administrative Office Clerks Entering and managing data in record keeping system Electronically scanning moderate to large sized files, copying, and filing Other administrative duties as assigned Qualifications Commitment of 5 days per week, 4 hours per day for 3 months or longer Positive attitude and self-motivated Administrative experience preferred Professional demeanor and punctuality Team oriented To Apply: Email resume and cover letter to volunteer@nylag.org with \"GAU Administrative Volunteer\" in the subject line.
