07465.title: Flooring installation expert

07003.description: Life is limited when you can't read medical label warnings, correspondence from your childrens' teachers, instructions on a new appliance, complete a job application, read a street sign, directions, or apply for a driver's license. Yet many adults find themselves in exactly that position, particularly here in Essex County, where one in every four adults is considered functionally illiterate in English, according to U.S. Department of Education data. When you help an adult, you help her or his entire family. At Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties, we have a long list of U.S. citizens and immigrants, among them refugees and asylum seekers, waiting for help in learning to speak, understand, read, and write in English. But we need volunteers to teach them. Here's how you can help: Become a volunteer literacy tutor by attending our 18-hour tutor training course at Park United Methodist Church, 12 Park Street, Bloomfield, NJ 07003, Mondays & Wednesdays, 10:30 am to 1:30 pm, April 23, 25, 30, May 2, 7, & 9, 2018. Volunteers work once per week for two hours and earn a certificate as tutors of Basic Literacy and English for Speakers of Other Languages from Literacy Volunteers of America (LVA), one of the largest non-profit adult literacy organizations in the country. And more than that, they help improve the lives of adults and their family members. For more information, please contact LVA at 973-566-6200, ext 225, via email rbenali@lvaep.org, via text @ 973-441-3200, or register through our website www.lvaep.org/forms.html
07003.title: Hard times; here's how you can help
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07003.description: Be a Literacy Volunteer Share the Gift of Reading, Writing, and Speaking English Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties (LVA), is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping adults improve their ability to speak, read, and write English. As an LVA volunteer, you can help people achieve a more rewarding life through weekly tutoring in reading, writing, and speaking English. We have a long list of students waiting for help. Our students are comprised both of English speakers who need help becoming proficient at reading and writing, and speakers of other languages who need help learning English. The first step to becoming an LVA tutor is to register for one of Tutor-Training Workshops. Please visit our website at www.lvaep.org or call 973-566-6200, ext 225, or text 973-441-3200 for more details. \"Literacy is a bridge from misery to hope.\" Kofi Annan
07003.title: Share Your Gift of Literacy
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07003.description: The success of Autism Speaks Walk depends on the dedication and support of its volunteers. Volunteers assist in many capacities - set up, checking in participants, providing encouragement at water stops, kids activities and cleaning up after the event. You can recruit friends, family and coworkers to join you! http://act.autismspeaks.org/site/TR/Walk/NewJersey?fr_id=3759&pg=entry
07003.title: 2018 Autism Speaks Northern New Jersey Walk

07004.description: Embrace Relief is a 501 (c) (3) non-profit organization that brings together teams of volunteers to collaborate on humanitarian aid and disaster relief efforts. These groups provide an array of support, offering to assist financially, emotionally, and physically with the needs of families and communities ravaged by disaster. The foundation collects, delivers and distributes supplies and resources to families, individuals, and institutions in different countries. Embrace Relief is planning to start a new project. Everyone has a role in Embrace Relief. The organization is looking for volunteers for three months starting in January. Embrace Relief needs assistance in developing and contributing to public relations and marketing activities
07004.title: Public Relations

07006.description: On April 25, we are hosting \"Pearls of Wisdom\" a day-long Empowerment Workshop at Chatham University. The purpose of the event is to educate, empower and inspire young women aiming to pursue higher education and reach their potential . During the workshop, we have the following needs with their respective times: Set-up 7 am - 8 am Putting signs, setting up student materials, making sure everything is in order Check-in/Registration 8 am - 8:45 am Electronically checking in students, handing them bags and programs Presenter Assistant 8:30am - 12:00pm Assisting presenters with keeping time, session transitions and breaks and clean-up/set-up etc. as needed Clean-up 3pm - 4pm Taking all signs and gathering all workshop materials from Caldwell
07006.title: Event Volunteer! Young Women's Conference

08901.description: We are looking for a volunteer to help update or brochures
08901.title: Marketing
08901.org: Meals on Wheels in Greater New Brunswick

08901.description: Help combat community hunger at the 5 Loaves Pantry. Volunteers help unload and sort food, organize pantry items, and assist clients with shopping.
08901.title: Marketplace in New Brunswick

07081.description: On Monday, May 14th, Children’s Aid will host its 19th Annual Golf Classic at the world-class Baltusrol Golf Club in Springfield, New Jersey, home of the 2016 PGA Championship. The Golf Classic brings together executive- and senior-level professionals who share a commitment to helping children and families in need. Through this annual event, golfers and sponsors raise revenue to support the life-changing work of Children’s Aid. Following tournament play, guests are invited to enjoy a cocktail reception with carving stations and passed hors d’oeuvres, silent and live auctions, and a brief program. All net proceeds support Children’s Aid. We are seeking two professional photographers who would be willing to donate their time and talents to support this cause on this very special day. We would like to have one roaming photographer and one positioned at a popular hole in order to capture photos of foursomes. We realize this is a long day so we would be fine to break this up into two shifts - one for the morning and one for the late afternoon. Please note that in return for your services, we would recognize you at the event and in various marketing materials pre/post event and would provide you with an acknowledgement letter. Happy to go into more details if you are interested. Volunteer must be willing to work outside for long stretches of time. The event happens rain or shine. Volunteer would be responsible for his or her own transportation to and from Baltusrol Golf Club.
07081.title: Professional Photographer for Golf Outing at Baltusrol Golf Club (Springfield, NJ)

07652.description: The following goods/services are needed: Set-up includes tents, tables/chairs, signs, balloons, registration, mission, and children's activity areas prior to event. Individuals are needed at the start of event to cover registration (registering walkers, handing out shirts and other items), children's activities and food station. Volunteers to help clean-up after event Food donations from vendors: subs, sandwiches and/or pizza cotton candy machine and supplies kid's craft corner clown/character photographers
07652.title: Day-of volunteers for Great Strides-PARAMUS
07652.org: Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Greater New Jersey

07652.description: We need your support! Go the Distance for Autism Bike Ride is in need of volunteers for this years Ride. We have opportunities for all skill sets. Please go to https://www.gtd4autism.org to sign up. Or email me, Michelle; Crew & Volunteer Coordinator at mharper@eventage.net
07652.title: GoTheDistance for Autism

10471.description: We are hosting our annual Friendship Ball and are in need of photographers to help with our photobooth. The Friendship Ball is a prom-like event held in April that invites all members from our school chapters . Our buddy pairs attend the dance to show their support for Best Buddies, and all members are invited to share in our mission of friendship. The Friendship Ball is a n annual highlight of programs. It is a favorite and \"must-attend\" activity on the calendar for many of our participants. This event is so special in that it gives hundreds of teenagers with an intellectual disability the opportunity to experience a real high school formal.
10471.title: Help with our Friendship Ball by being a photographer & ushering!

10471.description: On Saturday, June 9, 2018 at 9:00 a.m., the Cristian Rivera Foundation is having their 1 st Annual Cristian Rivera Foundation 5K Walk/Run and we need your help. We are looking for volunteers to help with various tasks before, during and after the 5K. For your help, breakfast and lunch will be provided. All shifts start at 6:30 a.m., please note that all volunteers need to be 18 and over. For more information email us your name and # to: volunteers@cristianriverafoundation.org. Be a part of our team to help find a cure for DIPG. Thank you in advance. \"Full Steam Ahead\"
10471.title: Volunteers for 1st Annual Cristian Rivera Foundation 5K Walk/Run

07087.description: Use your skills to help the immigrant community and experience the joy of helping someone change their life. We are looking for committed volunteers to teach Spanish speaking students. Volunteers teach one, three-hour class a week for ten weeks. All classes are on Sundays. Previous teaching experience is not necessary, but commitment, ability and a desire to teach are key. Our teachers have included those with experience, those undergoing teacher training and those who have no experience at all. Some classes require Spanish speakers, but some do not. Comite En Union para Salvadorenos (CEUS) is a 501 (c)3 non-profit organization based in Union City, NJ that was founded by Central American refugees to help immigrants create a better life for themselves. The classes are now offered at Centro Comunitario CEUS, our community center 15 minutes from Manhattan. Our website is www.ceusnj.org. CEUS has organized ESL classes for 23 years.
07087.title: Teach English to immigrants - change your world and theirs!

10577.description: AIDSfreeAFRICA will be given many unsold items at the Be Green Kids Consignment Spring/Summer sale held at Purchase College April 19-22. We will need people to come promptly at the end of the sale at 5:30pm on Sunday, April 22 to help transport these items to Ossining. Additional information will be given prior to that date to anyone who volunteers for this opportunity.
10577.title: Donation pickup on 4/22/18

07764.description: We're looking to raise funds, awareness, and Bike MS to support the thousands of people living multiple sclerosis in our NJ Metro Area. Join us as a volunteer to do your part! The luggage team is responsible for helping move participants bikes on and off our truck. This includes heavy lifting! We hope you enjoy a workout!
07764.title: We Need a Luggage Team for Bike MS!
07764.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07764.description: Monmouth University 400 Cedar Avenue West Long Branch, NJ 07764 You can bring us closer to a world free of MS. Volunteering for Bike MS is fun with an important purpose. We unite as a community during Bike MS to make a powerful statement - to pedal toward a cure. Bike MS Coast the Coast will take place on Saturday, May 19 and Sunday, May 20. Cyclists and volunteers will participate in support of our mission to mobilize people and resources to drive research for a cure and to address the challenges of everyone affected by MS. We are looking for massage therapists for our finish line celebration! (business cards, flyers). SATURDAY, May 19 2018 FINISH LINE @ Monmouth University, West Long Branch, NJ 10:00AM - 3:00PM
07764.title: Volunteer at Bike MS as a Massage Therapist!
07764.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07764.description: We need volunteers to help us; Set-up and break down tables, tents, and chairs Check-in cyclists Cheer at the start line Pass out t-shirts, water, and snacks This is a great opportunity to bond with groups of friends and or coworkers while joining the movement to end MS forever. If you are interested, contact Michelle Almeida at Michelle.Almeida@nmss.org or visit BikeMS.org!
07764.title: Volunteer at Bike MS Coast the Coast 2018!!
07764.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07764.description: We are in need of SAG (Saftey and Gear Support) drivers for our Coast the Coast Bike MS! Our bike starts at Monmounth University and ends in Point Pleasant Beach. SAG drivers follow cyclists throughout this sceneic route to provide support if needed. If a participant's tire pops, or if they are tired and need to be picked up and taken to the next rest stop, the SAG drivers will assist. We do ask that our drivers complete a background and motorvehicle check. You will be provide with a one of our company vehicles, bike equipment, refreshments, a radio, and a volunteer t-shirt! If you are interested please contact Michelle Almeida at Michelle.Almeida@nmss.org or call 732-660-1005.
07764.title: Route Support Drivers for Bike MS Needed!
07764.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07760.description: Join us for our annual Bike MS: Coast the Coast 2018 as one of our Rest Stop volunteers! Rest Stop volunteers liven up our Bike MS route for our cyclists! Assist with rest stop set up, water and snack replenishment, cheering on our cyclists and rest stop breakdown. We very much want our rest stops to be a celebration, as we are trying to support those whose lives are affected by MS. THIS YEAR WE WANT YOU TO DECORATE OUR REST STOP! Along the route there will be themed rest stops from Mardi Gras, Super Heroes to the Royal Wedding. Feel free to choose one of our themes or pick your own! Groups are welcome!
07760.title: Join the party! Volunteer at our Bike MS Rest Stop in Sea Bright!
07760.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

08857.description: KiDz HuB is proud to Partner with Relay for Life this year to bring you LIVE coverage of this year's event. We need your help with setup break down and LIVE audiovisual production. KiDz HuB will be; Broadcasting this event LIVE from Lombardi Field. This year's Relay will take place May 19th from 12pm-12am! We are super excited to be broadcasting the celebration of 10 years of Relay in the Old Bridge community! Relay for Life is the volunteer-run organization of the American Cancer Society. Old Bridge has been raising money as a community with this event for 7 years. We are always looking for new members, ideas, and volunteers. The next meeting will be held on 3/23/17 at 7:00 in the OBHS Library. The Team Captain Meeting will occur with the Committee Meeting. All are welcome to attend. http://relay.acsevents.org/site/PageServer?pagename=relay_learn
08857.title: RELAY FOR LIFE, OLD BRIDGE NJ - LIVE PRODUCTION VOLUNTEERS

07974.description: This is an excellent opportunity for groups or businesses to volunteer! Since 2002 we have hosted a free STEM (Science Technology Engineering & Math) competition for middle school students in north NJ. This program challenges the students to work as a team to create a model solar powered car. In the process they learn communication skills, alternative energy technology, the engineering design process and have best of all they have fun! We award students for Speed, Engineering, Craftsmanship, Best Use of Recycled Materials and Progress Journal. We need volunteers to assist with the Speed portion of the competition by being Start Line and Finish Line Judges. We need Vehicle Judges to score cars in Engineering, Craftsmanship and Best Use of Recycled Materials. We have remote volunteer opportunities as well for scoring the students digital Progress Journal. We need volunteers to help at our Fix-It Table to repair broken cars. We need volunteers to distribute a digital survey for teachers and students. Most of all, we need volunteers that will be a positive and supportive voice as hundreds of middle school students present their creations. We need our volunteers to be able to arrive at 7:30am. Students arrive at 8:30am and racing begins at 9am. The award ceremony concludes at noon the latest and then we take down the event. This is an outdoor event but if we have inclement weather, we move indoors. You will be provided with an official \"Volunteer\" shirt to wear all day as well as a thank you present for your time. If this sounds like something you'd be interested in, please reach out to me at ktomasicchio@transoptions.org or call our office at 973-267-7600.
07974.title: Volunteer at a Model Car Competition!

06902.description: Walk MS Volunteers Each year, thousands of people across the country join the Walk MS volunteer team. From serving on planning committees and calling past participants to providing safety and support for riders at the event, volunteers make Walk MS happen, and are the foundation of why Walk MS is the largest cycling fundraising event in the country. Who can volunteer? Families, corporate groups and individuals are encouraged and welcome to volunteer. Some volunteer positions require a criminal and/or DMV background check, and some may involve driving or heavy lifting. But if you want to help, we guarantee we can find a place for you! Groups and individuals of all ages and abilities are invited to volunteer. We are always looking for youth clubs, corporate, and service-oriented community groups to lend a hand before, during, and after our events. When you decide to volunteer, you become part of the MS movement--a collective of passionate individuals, moving together to create a world free of MS. Together we provide support, have fun, and make a difference in the lives of people living with MS.
06902.title: Walk MS Stamford 2018

06902.description: The success of our annual benefit requires a coordinated effort between Staff, Benefit Committee members, and volunteers. We are looking for volunteers to help in all aspects of the event planning, set-up and preparation, and of course to join our team of staff/volunteers that run the event on Saturday night, May 5th. Responsibilities may include: inventorying, cataloging, data entry, and acknowledgement of auction items creative design for auction displays mass mailing preparation: stuff, seal and stamp guest registration into database The week before the event: Printing, sorting and collating data entry creative design work The day of event (May 5th) on-site set up The night of event (May 5th) check in / check out auction item management and collection clean up Volunteers can support all these functions or any aspect.
06902.title: Annual Gala Support
06902.org: CHILD GUIDANCE CENTER OF SOUTHERN CT INC

06902.description: For high school students entering 10th, 11th, and 12th grades and current college students who are interested in hands on learning about social justice, inequality, and its implications. The class will learn about the effects of: Housing instability in Fairfield County The school to prison pipeline Food insecurity in the land of plenty The achievement gap The lack of affordable health care Transportation barriers and challenges In this interactive classroom, students will take part in an off-site activity, research an issue that interests them and report out to their peers. HOTS (higher order thinking skills) will be exercised. The training is free though we are asking attendees to bring $50 to-$100 for a Giving Circle where you will pool your resources to donate to an organization making a difference. Comments from previous attendees; \"I never knew.\", \"I came in curious and now I'm committed.\", and \"I know now that I can make a difference.\" To know more, reply to this posting.
06902.title: Social Justice Training for Teens & College Students

06902.description: Volunteers make Bike MS possible! Each year, thousands of people across the country join the Bike MS volunteer team. From planning event details and calling past participants to providing safety and support for riders at the event, volunteers make Bike MS happen, and are the foundation of why Bike MS is the largest cycling fundraising event in the country. Who can volunteer? Families, corporate groups, and individuals of all ages and abilities are encouraged and welcome to volunteer. We are always looking for youth clubs, corporate, and service-oriented community groups to lend a hand before, during, and after our events. When you decide to volunteer, you become part of the MS movement - a collective of passionate individuals, moving together to create a world free of MS. Together we provide support, have fun, and make a difference in the lives of people living with MS. Some volunteer positions require a criminal and/or DMV background check, and some may involve driving or heavy lifting.
06902.title: Bike MS - Stamford 2018

06902.description: Our amazing volunteer Book Lady has given away over 40,000 books since she started filling our 2 outside community carts with books 3 years ago. Are you free Wednesday mornings between 10 and 11:30 to help haul boxes a few feet, place books on the shelves, and have fun with a a couple dozen three year olds who visit the carts every week. Not only is it a dream volunteer job, but Book Lady Lorrie is about as wonderful as they come.
06902.title: Help our Book Lady on Wednesday Mornings

06903.description: Media/News Writer Volunteer, If you enjoy writing, this is the volunteer job for you. We are looking for someone to create press releases about the Stamford History Center for distribution to various media outlets (onlinenews sites, radio, tv, magazines, etc.). You will interview people in the organization to gather information. Once your article is reviewed by our volunteer editors, it will be sent out. It is essential that our media volunteer stays up-to- date with our activities, so press releases go out in a timely fashion. The position can be expanded to include the creation of newsletters and flyers (working with our graphic designer). This is a job that can be done largely from your own laptop/desktop, and at your own convenience. REQUIREMENT: Please write a two or three paragraph \"Press Release\" on one of the following topics: 1] About our Tag Sale 2] The opening of the Hoyt-Barnum House or 3] A past Historical Center event You can get ideas by going to our web site: www.stamfordhistory.org Forward it to me and we will review and get back to you. Thanks again for your interest in joining the volunteer team! Tom Tom Porter Volunteer Coordinator Stamford History Center 1508 High Ridge Road Stamford, CT 06903 www.stamfordhistory.org 203-329-1183 Skills needed: organized, experienced writer; a self-starter who can use Word and navigate the internet.
06903.title: Media/News Writer Volunteer

06903.description: Historic Home Docent & Museum Greeter We are looking for volunteers who would like to introduce visitors to our 1699 historic house museum, The Hoyt-Barnum House. You would be involved with greeting visitors with a smile and giving a brief explanation of the Center's offerings: a research library, photo archive, our current exhibit, and our historic house museum. People who wish to tour Hoyt-Barnum House first view an introductory film before starting the audio tour. You would be responsible for selling tickets and recording transactions, giving guests their audio pods and collecting them after the tours, opening and closing up the house museum, and monitoring visitors while they are in the house. Minimal training is needed. Museum Docents should be friendly and personable. They should be physically able to manage stairs and brief walks on a regular basis. Docents should be at least 20 years old and able to work at least one four-hour day, 2 x /month. Docents are needed for Thursdays and Fridays. Shifts are from noon to 3:15 pm on Thursdays and Fridays. Two docents are needed on Saturday: one from 10:30 - 1:00 and one from1:00 to 3:30 pm. You are welcome to stay longer to meet our other volunteers and make use of our facility. Check out our Website for loads of fun information: http://stamfordhistory.org/ Skills needed: -Basic math/money skills Hope to hear from you soon! Tom Tom Porter Volunteer Coordinator & Board Member Stamford History Center 1508 High Ridge Road Stamford, CT 06903 www.stamfordhistory.org volunteer@stamfordhistory.org (O) 203-329-1183 (C) 917-701-3572
06903.title: Stamford Historic Home - Tour Guide (No experience needed)

06901.description: Stamford Academy serves about 135 high school students who have been unsuccessful within the traditional school model. The ratio of students with Individual Education Plans (IEP) is about twice the rate of Stamford Public Schools, yet Stamford is able to provide only one SPED teacher. You know how important one-on-one instruction is. Do you have a couple of hours to spare once a week during the school year to help tutor a student? Training provided. To meet our kids is to love them. They are wary and giving; have big dreams and struggle to stay on task; are talented and funny; and may have not had dinner the night before. If you'd like to know more, please contact me.
06901.title: Do you know what an IEP is? If so, read on...

06901.description: Stamford Academy serves about 135 high school students who have been unsuccessful within the traditional school model. The ratio of students with IEPs is about twice the rate of Stamford Public Schools, yet Stamford is able to provide only one SPED teacher. Do you have a couple of hours to spare once a week during the school year to help with one-on-one tutoring? To meet our kids is to love them. They are wary and giving; have big dreams and struggle to stay on task; are talented and funny; and may have not had dinner the night before. If you'd like to know more, please contact me.
06901.title: Retired SPED Teachers & Para Educators Wanted

10466.description: Provide counseling and supportive services to high school students. Provide career and college counseling and advising to high school students. Paid Volunteer Position
10466.title: School Social Worker

10467.description: Help invest in the life of a child by becoming a A Elementary Group Teacher with our Early Scholars Saturday Academy! Teach grades K-6, develop lesson plans, test students, grading & More! Be a part of something great and volunteer today!
10467.title: Elementary Group Teacher

10467.description: Gain exceptional skills in administration, office management and clerical work by volunteering with I'RAISE Girls & Boys International. Bi-Weekly Stipend of $200.00 Hours are flexible. College Students are welcome!
10467.title: Administrator

11552.description: As part of the office team, the clerical assistant will assist with clerical duties such as filing, collating, faxing and copying.
11552.title: Clerical Assistant

10463.description: Volunteer at the Kingsbridge Heights Community Center's Neighborhood Festival on Saturday, May 5th from 1 PM - 5 PM honoring Earth Day with Latino Outdoors. Join us for an afternoon of garden work and family-friendly activities. Help with the clean up and break down of the Neighborhood Festival. Refreshments will be provided! Come by at 11 AM for our Neighborhood Festival, and join us at 1 PM to volunteer! Location: KHCC's Park (next to the main building on 3101 Kingsbridge Terrace) If you have any questions please feel free to e-mail Anahi at anaranjo@khcc-nyc.org. Hope to see you there! SIGN UP HERE: https://goo.gl/forms/J5GiQzaZmlviGgH02
10463.title: Neighborhood Volunteer Festival Volunteer

10463.description: The Special Needs Program at the Kingsbridge Heights Community Center is designed to provide students with the same opportunities as all children in New York City, from fitness to creative spaces. We are looking for volunteers to help with our Respite After School Program on Mondays and Wednesdays between the hours of 3:15 pm and 5:30 pm. The 3:15 pm - 4 pm would be for volunteers who are interested in running arts and crafts activities, but between 4 and 5:30 pm could be for volunteers interested in helping with homework, or run gym activities.
10463.title: Special Needs After-School Volunteer

10463.description: Position Statement: Evening classes, 6:00pm-9:30pm Monday - Thursday The ESOL (English Students of Other Languages) Program Assistant will be responsible for one-on-one support to students during classroom English lesson plans, administrative support to the instructor/s, and technical aspects of assisting students with progressing computer-based language programs. Duties and Responsibilities: Provide participants with one-on-one assistance Assist with technical and administrative tasks Provide administrative back-up and support to ESOL Instructor Engage and retain students by developing supportive relationships Other duties as assigned by Instructor Qualifications: HS Diploma; Some college preferred Comfort with computer applications and data entry Available evening hours Organized, efficient, and task oriented English/Spanish Bi-lingual helpful
10463.title: ESOL Program Volunteer

10460.description: We are currently recruiting adult volunteers (21+) for Spring 2018! Applicants will be invited to an information session and group interview in January or February. We have many different ways you can participate in our volunteer program. Our volunteer specialties offer something for everyone: AMBASSADOR Our Ambassadors have the important role of greeting zoo visitors, helping them to find their way, and sharing \"what’s happening today!\" (2 day training, 8+ hour a month commitment) WCS NOW Our WCS Now Interpreters facilitate interactive, conservation based activities around the zoo. For this role, we are looking for volunteers that are committed to sharing the WCS mission and message, are outgoing and approachable, are comfortable interacting with large groups, and are eager to learn and try new things. (6 day training, plus online courses, 12+ hour a month commitment) EXPEDITION LEADER Expedition Leaders at the Bronx Zoo lead inquiry-based tours for school children, private groups, families, or other pre-registered participants. If you have a passion for engaging people in observation and critical thinking, are an excellent listener with a strong interest in inquiry, are comfortable managing groups of all sizes, and have a commitment to teaching in response to learner feedback-the Expedition Leader role would be a great fit for you! (*Now Interpreter training a prerequisite, 2 day training, 12+ hour a month commitment) PLAY PARTNER As a Play Partner, you will facilitate nature play based activities in our new Nature Trek exhibit, as well as alongside our Conservation Educators and Fellows during Nature Club events and meetings. If you enjoy spending time outside and embracing all the elements, consider becoming a Play Partner volunteer! (1 day training, 12+ hour a month commitment) EDUCATION ASSISTANT As an Education Assistant, you may greet groups as they arrive to the zoo and guide them to their classrooms, provide support to our Conservation Educators during programs or activities, or assist with family programs, birthday parties, or summer camps! (2 day training, 12 + hours a month commitment). ON-CALL EVENT SUPPORT If you’re interested in volunteering at the Bronx Zoo, but have limited time to commit, consider joining us as an On-Call Event Support Volunteer! You’ll be called upon to help with special events throughout the year. (Online training, 1-2 events per year) To learn more, and apply, visit bronxzoo.com/volunteering
10460.title: Volunteer at the Bronx Zoo!

10460.description: Ariva is a Non-Profit tax Organization that does taxes for the lower-income households in all 5 boroughs. Volunteer Income tax assistants have the opportunity to receive IRS certified tax training, and upon completion of the test, their primary duties will be preparing tax returns. Alternative activities include, intake (help with customer service) and data entry (the IRS requires us to take polls of all of our customers). There are 12 sites located mostly in the Bronx, and Manhattan. We have morning, evening, and weekend hours with no problem working around your schedule and getting you into your preferred location. LET'S HELP OUT OUR COMMUNITY TOGETHER!!
10460.title: Volunteer Income Tax Assistant

08837.description: We are looking for Master of Science in Education (MS.Ed.) interns. Highly motivated professionals Willing to learn new upcoming teaching methods Willing to work with autism and other disabilities Training will be provided From Internship to Paid after school for 3 hrs per day please email manishaladnc@gmail.com
08837.title: We are looking for Special educators interns.

08837.description: Hiring interns/college students with specialities in special education to work with our 16 year old son diagnosed with Autism. (Bachelor's or Masters degree education) Highly motivated and energetic professionals. Willing to learn new upcoming teaching methods (e.g. Ipad based communication) Training will be provided. 1-3 hrs per day. Contact Manisha Lad: 732-887-4263
08837.title: Help us find Tutor-Helper-Buddy for our son (16 yr old)

07073.description: March for Babies is the signature fundraising walk for March of Dimes. Meadowlands March for Babies is a new regional fundraising walk for participants from Hudson, Essex, Passaic and Bergen counties, it is expected to draw near 2500 participants. We are in need of groups to work the registration area, groups to provide family friendly activities and groups to be set up as water stations aling the walk. Volunteers are also needed for logistical help in the months leading up to the walk. Bagels and coffee are provided in the morning, we have music and activities for after the three mile walk. Fundraising teams are also needed and can register at www.marchforbabies/event/meadowlands
07073.title: March for Babies- Meadowlands

07073.description: Walk With Us To Cure Lupus - New Jersey! Walkers and Volunteers Needed! Walkers needed to help raise funds for lupus research. Form a team or walk individually. Be a part of the cause and join us today! Volunteers are needed to assist with set-up, clean-up, handing out food and water, cheering our walkers on and working tables. We are also looking for people to donate their services if they are massage therapists, photographers, bag pipers and marching bands to lead the walk. Entertainment for children is also in need. Please contact Joanne Golombos for more information: jgolombos@lupusresearch.org or call 732-842-1607
07073.title: Walk With Us to Cure Lupus - New Jersey

10469.description: I'RAISE Offers an exciting and rewarding opporunity to individuals seeking to become a role model and make a positive impact on younger youth. This exciting opportunity includes one on one mentoring, group mentoring and/or mentoring. Mentors work with mentees on developing goals for their life that will help them make social, emotional and educational gains! Ideal candidates include college students. students who need internship experience/volunteer experience, retired professionals or individuals who simply want to make a difference! If you are seeking an opportunity to invest in a youth and make a positive difference.
10469.title: Big Brother/Big Sister Mentor

07050.description: Arts Unbound is a non-profit gallery and art studio in Orange serving people with disabilities and seniors. In May, Arts Unbound is hosting our fourth annual ArtBender. ArtBender is a series of creative events that raise funds for Arts Unbound programs and promote art in our daily lives. Join the 12-hour art-making marathon, attend an ArtBender party, help raise funds, or attend the silent auction. There will be events all weekend, May 5-6 and a silent art auction, May 11, 2018. Celebrate your creative nature...reveal the unrealized potential in all of us...and help Arts Unbound raise $50,000 to support artists with disabilities. We need volunteers to help make ArtBender a success. We are looking for local folks to help with the following: Distribute posters to local businesses Distribute postcards to local public places (libraries, coffee shops, groceries) and businesses Ask for refreshment donations for art marathon and auction Ask businesses, especially barbershops, hair salons, and nail salons, to participate Encourage people to host a bender or attend one Sell auction tickets In your reply, please tell us which tasks you'd like to take on.
07050.title: ArtBender Volunteer

11793.description: The National MS Society is looking for volunteers to help with general registration at Walk MS: Jones Beach! Walk MS: Jones Beach 2018 will be held on Saturday, May 19th at Jones Beach - Field 1 on Long Island. We need over 200 volunteers for this exciting event - we welcome groups and individuals of all ages & abilities to join us as volunteers! Walk MS is a charity walk series that takes place in over 550 locations with more than 300,000 people participating annually. When you participate in Walk MS, you are helping create a world free of multiple sclerosis. Together, we become a powerful force. Together, we will end MS forever. If you are interested in volunteering, please review the position below and register online here: http://main.nationalmssociety.org/site/TR/Walk/NYHWalkEvents?pg=entry&fr_id=29834 General Registration Team Date: Saturday, May 19 Location: Jones Beach, Field 1 (1 Ocean Parkway, Wantagh, NY 11793) Time: General Registration - 7:00am-11:00am Description: Greet and sign-in walkers as well as help registration run efficiently- Volunteers must be 18+ & Background Check If you have any questions, please contact: Amber Young - Manager, Volunteer Engagement at Amber.Young@nmss.org
11793.title: General Registration Volunteers Needed at Walk MS: Jones Beach!

07470.description: We need enthusiastic volunteers to help with our Children's enrichment program held on Wed/Sat/Sundays at the YMCA in Wayne NJ. While their parents work on learning English in a nearby classroom, help us with activities for the children across the hall. Sometimes we help children with homework, other times we grab a book and read together to work on English pronunciation and vocabulary. Sometimes we draw, or play games like \"Simon Says\" or \"Guess Who\" to both keep moving and work on our spoken English. Volunteers need not commit to all 3 sessions, but volunteers must commit to at least 4 hours per week. You do not need to be a trained teacher to help. Kindness, a sense of humor, a commitment to cultural understanding and exchange is a good place to start. After one session we will ask any volunteers with direct contact with children to complete a background check.
07470.title: Tutors and Helpers for refugee children
07470.org: GLOBAL EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND ASSISTANCE GERA

07095.description: We are getting ready for our 11 Walk MS fundraisers at the end of this month and we need help packing! With 11 different locations, we have a lot of materials to pack. We need help counting our materials, sorting them into bins, and loading them in our material vans. Our office is located in Woodbridge, NJ. 1480 U.S. Highway 9 North. THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT
07095.title: Help Us Pack for Walk MS!
07095.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07095.description: Bike MS: Coast the Coast is a two-day bike ride on May 19th and 20th. A lot of information needs to be mailed out to all our participants and we need help organizing all of it! Join us on Tuesday, May 2nd as we organize through our rider numbers, and letter. PIZZA will be provided! JOIN THE MOVEMENT TO END MS
07095.title: We Need Help Organizing!
07095.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

08902.description: The success of Walk MS is directly related to the wonderful volunteers who dedicate their time to the chapter. We welcome volunteers of all ages, abilities and talents to assist with a variety of volunteer opportunities. There is only one requirement - a desire to see a world free of MS! All Walk MS volunteers receive: Volunteer T-shirt Snacks and beverages Community service hours Plenty of smiles, high fives and thanks! Check out our Walk MS Volunteer Opportunities! Check-In Crew: Volunteers assist in event set-up, register walk-on participants, and hand out T-shirts. 7 AM - 11 AM Cheer Crew: Encourage and cheer-on our event participants. 9 AM - 2 PM Set-up/Break-down Crew: Volunteers will assist with setting up and breaking down tables and chairs, posting signage and moving boxes/other event supplies (must be able to lift boxes, stand for long periods of time and bend). Set-up: 6:30 AM - 11 AM Break-down: 10 AM - 2 PM Entertainers: We’re looking for musicians, DJs, face painters, magicians, clowns, balloon artists and more to donate their time and join the movement. Photographers: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. TO REGISTER visit: www.walkms.org
08902.title: Join the Movement! Volunteer at Walk MS 2018 in North Brunswick!
08902.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter
